Reviews.Title: “a great hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: chrisdy
Reviews.Content: we had a great 4 night break over easter and can't praise the hotel and the staff, especially Matteo, enough. Nice clean rooms & very good breakfast The hotel is in an area which is being gentrified so the outlook from the rear balcony wasn't great and there was some building work noise from neighboring properties but as we were out exploring this fantastic city it had no effect on our stay Matteo gave us a discount card for local bars which was well used

Reviews.Title: “Book early!”
Reviews.Author: nunaka
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel can't be beat, close to the main La Rambla but far enough away that noise was not a problem. We had flown in from Australia and were thoroughly jet-lagged, so being able to sleep was important to us. The room was very clean, with interesting decor, large photo murals of Barcelona. Hotel staff were fluent in English, tolerant of my attempts to remember high school Spanish and quite helpful. We were sorry they didn't have room for us after our cruise and we had to stay elsewhere, so "book early".

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Don N
Reviews.Content: My friend and I both agree that we wouldn't bother staying anywhere else next time we're in Barcelona. The Hotel Curious is perfectly located down a cozy street just off of La Ramblas and La Boqueria. You are a 10-minute walk from the Liceu (Green) and 15-minutes from Plaza Catalunya (almost all lines); which is also one of the stops for the airport shuttle bus. The hotel has clean modern-styled decor and although the rooms are relatively small in size, they are clean, stylish, comfortable, and have all the conveniences that you need. Service was fantastic and the breakfast was adequate. However, I would recommend walking 5-minutes to the Boqueria in the morning for breakfast, market strolling, and fantastic people watching. Overall, the location and quality of the Hotel Curious exceeded our expectations and won us over as devout fans.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Pjvthomas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay in Barcelona. Hotel is perfectly located, just off the main La Rambla area. Hotel is very modern, exceptionally clean everywhere and well maintained. Rooms are very comfortable and well equipped with TV and hair dryer. Modern feel of the rooms gives the relatively small rooms a spacious feel. Breakfast was great - continental style, fresh with good choice. Reception staff make the hotel. Always friendly and polite. They are only too happy to offer advice on anything from where to visit, what time is best to go, where to eat, transport system and weather. They recommended two places to eat at and both were fantastic. If you stay here make sure you make the most of their excellent local knowledge. In summary, great hotel, perfect location, fantastic staff. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Construction...”
Reviews.Author: cfegeley
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write this review becasue some of this many be beyond the control of the hotel itself, but how the situation was handled was very poor. The staff at check-in was great and the room itself was very good. We also enjoyed our breakfast on the one morning we stayed there. We were booked at the Hotel Curious for 3 Nights, but after our 1st night we had no choice but to check-out. There was construction going on in the building connected to the hotel and the noise in our room was so loud you would have thought the workers were standing next to us. Voices, yelling, hammering, power drills, etc. It was HORRIBLE! When I asked/told the front desk about the noise it seemed as if theyvsimply could care less. Telling me, "Yes, there is construction going on, there is nothing we can do about it." While that may be true, a decent room where sleeping is possible is surely not too much to ask. They even refused to move us to a room without all the construction noise for the duration of our stay. I was shocked by this, especially after reading all the good reviews. The man working the desk, Mateo, was not helpful in the least and refused to take any blame for the hotel renting out this particular room, which was truly unbearable. I am very disappointed with this property, we relocated to the Hotel Turin down the street which was quite nice. It would have been a great place to stay without this happening, be sure to ask about construction before booking!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central”
Reviews.Author: Sandra_Diris
Reviews.Content: I went in March on a citytrip to Barcelona with my mother. We've stayed here 4 nights. Location is excellent: in the middle of the center but quiet at night. Our room was small, but very clean! We had our own balcony, which was also very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. They speak fluent English and French. Nice breakfast, with eggs, croissants, cheese, meat, yoghurt,...This is certainly a place I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Lesley_C_F
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 2nd to 6th April. The hotel is spotless and an excellent base for the whole of the city, being very close to Las Ramblas and a Metro Station. Staff very helpful, breakfast plentiful. As a solo traveller, I felt very comfortable, safe and relaxed here. Hope to return sometime and no hesitation in recommending Hotel Curious.

Reviews.Title: “A good find in a big city”
Reviews.Author: Hazeyfantasey
Reviews.Content: Value for money, we couldn't fault Hotel Curious - very clean and comfortable, nice breakfast and good front of house service - yes, the rooms are small but not a problem on a city sight-seeing trip

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bostongolfers
Reviews.Content: This Hotel boasts of being one of those where simple is better, and they are right. The management is on the premises and it is locted in the heart of everything. Its on a side street near the main "promanade" and close to everything you need. Barcelona is a beautiful city and you will enjoy being in the heart of it all. Internet is valiable in the lobby for guests without charge and breakfast is provided. A nice place in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value; Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Scott052
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Curious for 4 nights in transit to Brasil. A great little hotel. The rooms are small, as are most European rooms (and certainly smaller than the professional photo on the listing) but very well laid out and didnt feel cramped at all. And the location is perfect right off the Ramblas and the rooms very quiet at night. The front desk staff are all very helpful and the service was very good. Again, very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sarahs2176
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Curious for a long weekend at the beginning of March. We were very impressed by the hotel, bearing in mind its competitive price. The hotel is in an excellent location - being approx 4 roads down from the Placa De Cantalunya - at the Northern end of the notrious road "Las Ramblas". It was a few hundred yards from Liceu metro station which can take you all over Barcelona! There were lots of bars, shops, restaurants, stalls, market, etc within a very short distance of the hotel. We were even given a discount card by the hotel to use in the locality. The hotel staff were very friendly and knowledgeable (especially Matteau) and couldn't do enough for you. The front reception desk was manned 24 hours and the security of the hotel and rooms was good. The rooms themselves were split into 4 different elements - air, water, fire and earth and decorated with this in mind. We stayed in one of the "water" rooms. It was basic and compact but was nicely decorated and comfortable and had virtually everything in it which we needed for our stay - en suite shower room, double bed, side cabinets, a clever compact wardrobe/table set, chair, full length mirror, flat screen tv, etc. Our room also had double doors which opened onto a lovely little balcony at the rear of the hotel. This was very refreshing late at night and early morning! We found there was very little noise and this helped us to have a good night's sleep! The only thing that we felt could improve the room was tea/coffee making facilities. Our room was very clean and the cleaners came in each day to clean, change the bedding and change towels. The hotel also had a breakfast room, which was clean and staffed and where you could obtain a full spread of breakfast between 8 and 11 am each day, including cereals, breads, cakes, dairy products, teas/coffees, etc. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Curious again and recommend it to friends. Thanks for a lovely stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't quite live up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Londoner27
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of location, price and the excellent TA reviews. The first 2 were as expected but overall the service and rooms did not quite live up to expectations. When we arrived, tired and carrying luggage, the lady on reception was in the middle of explaining something to another set of guests. She asked us to wait and we stood waiting for about 15 mins - which is fine and which we're not complaining about: we realise that's how queues work. But then when _we_ had just started to check in, someone without a booking came in to ask about spare beds for the evening. Instead of finishing dealing with us first, the receptionist promptly stopped and proceeded to spend a good 15 minutes discussing hostel options with new arrival. Overall, it took us almost 3/4 hour to check in and we were pretty unimpressed with the welcome. That having been said, the man on reception on the day we checked out was very friendly helpful, so it wasn't all bad on the service front. The room was clean and not as noisy as we had feared given the central location and modern walls. However, it was small (certainly smaller than I have stayed in previously in Madrid or Barcelona in this price range) and the air con unit struggled with the temperature. Also, the bed was a bit thin and it wasn't possible to prevent the shower water from spilling onto the bathroom floor. Finally, as others have mentioned, the storage space is inadequate. The breakfasts were adequate but limited in range. Overall given the choice of places in Barcelona and the welath of special deals on offer, we wouldn't choose this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Service”
Reviews.Author: Fix32
Reviews.Content: A great location, just off the Ramblas and close to lots of sites, but still quiet. Very clean and the rooms are immaculate and freshly decorated and clean. Breakfast very good and the service of all the staff we met were smashing. Unfortunately we chose the coldest weekend of the year to visit Barcelona (-4 to +4 degrees only) and as the heating only turns on through the air conditioning when you put the put the card key in the slot, then the room was initially a little cool...but did heat up after staying in it a while. Very understandable though under the unusual circumstances. I'd definitely recommend this hotel for someone wanting to see the sights in Barcelona at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves the good revues.”
Reviews.Author: ravstereo
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this award winning hotel. Thoroughly deserves it's good reviews. Found it to be comfortable and with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Give them another award”
Reviews.Author: Sentace
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last week for three nights and everything was perfect. Everyone from the staff were extremely helpful and they made my stay so much more pleasant with information about the city I came to them asking. My room was just what I needed, clean and quiet, the bathroom was also clean... I basically cant think of one bad thing to say about this hotel. They are as advertised! One thing is for sure, if you chose Curious you wont make a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Almost as good as the other reviews state!”
Reviews.Author: SomiLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location in a rather run-down street just off La Rambla with the advantage of nearby good inexpensive restaurants nearby and close to obvious attractions. Clever refurbishment of an old building to produce functional modern bedroom kept very clean. Storage (for clothes) is a challenge and could have been better thought through. Great shower in a good sized but poorly ventilated room. Noisy from 08:00 onwards. Poor choice of TV channels. Excellent free Wi-Fi, really nice staff

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Jan150267
Reviews.Content: we (my daughter and myself) stayed at the Hotel Curious for 3 nights and had the most lovely time. The hotel was in a great location just off La Ramblas so it was easy to walk to many of the great places in that area. Staff were so helpful in advising us how to get to other sights too - even drawing and writing directions on our map so we couldn't go wrong! The room was really clean and perfectly suitable for a short break (fab shower - really powerful!). The only slight improvement would have been provision of a kettle and a couple of cups as i would have loved a cuppa in our room a couple of times !Breakfast was delicious with lots of choice and set us both up perfectly for the day. Thanks to everyone at the hotel for making us so welcome and looking after us with such courtesy and good humour. It was lovely that staff took the trouble to reply to tweets and facebook comments too prior to our arrival , a lovely personal touch . We would love to return to this hotel again in the future. Jan and Lyndsey x

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: sirs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for For the weekend. 16 girls. Hotel is an ideal location, near las ramblas. I read that the rooms are small but I found them average. No safe but lovely and modern. The rooms are ideal. I was the organiser for the trip and before the visit I often emailed or tweeted the hotel. They always replied with a detailed answer. Thank you to all the staff who made my job easier ! The breakfast is continental. I would not fault this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable little hotel at a decent rate”
Reviews.Author: DaveyWaveyLondon
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel in the very heart of Barcelona. During my stay, the staff were friendly and helpful and the room, while compact, was spotlessly clean. My 'single' bed, whilst not long, was quite wide and very comfortable, meaning that I could sleep well (even though I'm rather tall). The room was quiet at night, with effective curtains blocking out the light, ensuring a good quality of sleep. Things did get quite noisy in the morning (from about 9am onwards), with some construction noise from next door, or with the maid clattering *loudly* in adjacent rooms, so this may not be the best place for a lie in! The en-suite bathroom facilities were fine, as was the 'buffet-style' breakfast. The free wifi seemed slightly temperamental (it only seemed to work for certain types of device), but there was a PC in the lobby available for general guest use. There were no tea/coffee-making facilities in the room, and no bottled water, which I was surprised by. However, there is a small shop a couple of dozen yards away where you can buy bottled water. There was also no safe in the room, however the staff can securely store any valuables for you behind reception. For those looking for a basic but clean and comfortable hotel near the centre of Barcelona, you'd struggle to find a much better deal than this. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value”
Reviews.Author: JHoop81
Reviews.Content: Is this really just a one star hotel? Great location just off Las Ramblas, very modern and exceptionally clean. Staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was always fresh and tasty. Rooms were basic and didn't have a safe or storage (apart from a few hangers and shelves), but this didn't bother us one bit. Would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone who doesn't want to spend a fortune on a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “curious hotel recomend”
Reviews.Author: jonnoj
Reviews.Content: im back from barcelona and would like to take this time just to say that the curious hotel staff have to be one of the best i have come across.they were polite and very informative and really went out of there way to help us in any way,even helped in printing our return tickets.the hotel is small but very clean.The house cleaners really did a great job.The breakfast was nice,fresh and loads of it.there is a building site next door but we were there to see barcelona not to hang around the hotel so it made little affect to us.the hotel is in an excelent location,in the heart of the city.If u get the bus go to the tourist information kiosk close by and the will direct you directly there and once you find it you will be delighted,just off Las Ramblas but none of the late night sounds that go with it.I would recomend this hotel as the price was fantastic,50 euro's a night with breakfast ,great location ,clean,well kept and great staff.special thanks to the day time girl who helped us with the tickets. Diana and John

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: TomAndMarta
Reviews.Content: A small and clean hotel in a very central location. The staff were very friendly and helpful and didn't seem to mind that we couldn't say a word in Spanish. The breakfast was simple but fresh and satisfying. We would definitely go back to the same place as it is just what we were looking for - no luxuries but a very pleasant stay. We felt that the price was very fair.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Alex N
Reviews.Content: "Hotel Boutique", centrally located near "Las Ramblas" and the night life of Barcelona, it has a very cosy environment, excellent room and bedroom and a delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: pat_john1
Reviews.Content: Booked with confidence after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. Stayed 3 nights with a party of 14 and everyone gave it 5/5. Reception staff friendly and welcoming especially Caryn with her great sense of humour and local knowledge of bars and restaurants. Rooms were perfect-----we had different types of rooms from singles to triples, no-one had any complaints. The breakfast was a great bonus. The staff are so pleasant and helpful,any request they try to meet. It is so good to get this kind of service today, particular with a city centre hotel. I would encourage anyone going to Barcelona to try this hotel-----you will not be disappointed. Great location, meticulously clean, and above all courteous and friendly. We would definitely stay here again and have no reservations in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel but spotlessly clean.”
Reviews.Author: KevEastBoldon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a pre cruise stay on 12.01.2012 after reading positive reviews on trip advisor - was'nt disappointed. The hotel is ideally situated, very close to La Rambla and La Plaza de Cataluna and therefore within easy walking distance from the airport shuttle bus stop (Aerobus). Rooms are basic but spotlessly clean. Continental breakfast is adequate. In short, excellent for a short stay in Barcelona at a reasonable price. Would'nt hesitate in staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Though just a 1-star, this is a gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: zoolooklogie
Reviews.Content: I booked this based on other Tripadvisor reviews, and it was just t be a base fora 2-night stay in Barcelona. As we came closer to the arrival date, I was a little worried that maybe I had aimed too low. I needn't have worried because upon arrival, we were met with as friendly and helpful staff I think I have ever encountered whilst travelling. The hotel was extremely clean, and our room was in top-notch condition; beautiful old street just off La Rambla, our own balcony, and excellent bathroom - all in A1 condition. Barcelona is a fascinating and relaxing city, and Hotel Curious is an excellent base to explore from. If I was returning to Barcelona, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Loved it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Caroline K
Reviews.Content: A clean and modern hotel located off Las Ramblas and behind the Boqueria. The rooms are small, but extremely clean. Conveniently located and even has a room that can fit three people. Great neighborhood and easy access to key attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: bigb77
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel just off las Ramblas. When we arrived we were greeted by Mateo who took the time to show us a map of the city and point out interesting sights and gave us recommendations. My wife fell in love with him! We were going to a football game that night and he gave us great directions on how to get there and what time to go. Room was nice, average size for Europe, bathroom was also adequately sized. The breakfast is amazing, we ate so much - cereal, yogurt, juice, croissants, cold meats (jamon!), pastries and fresh fruit! the donuts (i think they are called xixos) were the most amazing I have ever tasted! The staff really do go the extra mile to make you feel at home and every request is answered with a smile. The location is ideal for a first time tourist and the room was quite at night. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone - for the price it is a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “If you're curious check out the Hotel Curious!”
Reviews.Author: Ayimaster
Reviews.Content: Recently we spent 4 days in the hotel. When one is travelling for business, tourism or family visit, hotel is one of the important aspect of one's stay. In this case, our trip to Barcelona was brightened not only by the hospitality of the city, but also by the staff in the Hotel Curious. The Hotel is centrally located, so if you would like to visit the old town and the museums in the area, it is very easy because you are within a reach to this hotel, wherever you go. Also, one of the highlights was the big market, which is also close to the hotel. The breakfast is great and served with care. I would like to thank the staff, especially the front desk for their genuine and kind attitude to their guests.

Reviews.Title: “gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: emma q
Reviews.Content: just back from 3 x night stay at hotel curious. Cannot agree more with all previous positive guest comments. Accomodation is perfectly situated just off Las Ramblas. Rooms small but clean and modern, all you need. Plenty of bars, restaurants, shops in this lively buzzin city. A real gem for the price. Some noise from 8am from construction going on in neighbouring building. (Nothing that bothered us though). Staff really helpful. Bargin prices for a primely positioned inner city hotel. Public transport in Barca is v good, no need to jump expensive taxis. Can travel on Metro underground for 2Euros per trip (less for multi trips). City best explored on foot though to really appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel- feels like home”
Reviews.Author: ester h
Reviews.Content: I spent 10 days at Hotel Curious. It is very centrally located- 20 meter walk from La Rambla, dozens of excellent restaurants in the same street, 5 minute walk to MACBA and 3 blocks from Plaza Catalunia. It's a small hotel (25 rooms). The rooms are spacious, contain everything you need for a great stay. Sacious bathroom, lots of light (I hate dark bathrooms)- beds are clean, comfortable, there are two little sofas and 2 retractable desks in the room- Lots of outlets. The most important feature is the staff- always the same, very attentive to your needs, nice breakfast with everything you may like to eat with no excess. Fresh juice and espresso as well. Wi-fi works very well and is free! Really feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there last november, became major on 4square..,”
Reviews.Author: Christoph0002
Reviews.Content: Went to Curious last November. Thanks to google street view, we found the hotel right away. Room was ok and clean. Think ibis style. Regarding the location, the touristy type is satisfied with proximity of the Ramblas. The more cultural minded person is satisfied with the proximity of the MCAB and the vintage and designer shops in Born. I can recommend buying Phaidon Barcelona. During our stay, we were woken up early due to construction nearby. That was a bit uncool, but it was compensated due to the fact that I became the Mayor of the Hotel on Foursquare, which resulted in a nice discount. All in all, I'm coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Ruth C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in a double room at Hotel Curious while in Barcelona last Spring and this hotel is amazing value for money. Despite being budget focused, not only is the hotel thoughtfully presented from a design perspective, it also offers brilliant customer service and a perfect location off Las Ramblas (and just 5 minutes from La Boqueria market-a must see!).Oh and all bookings include a free buffet breakfast- whats not to love?!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: MiaMew
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect right at the centre! room was decent size and clean. When you're in Barca, you don't stay in the room but explore the lively city! so this hotel was great to rest after a long day out!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pilar11l
Reviews.Content: My wife, my two girls and I stayed here for a night, during a two week trip through France and Spain in late december. The hotel met all our expectations, wondeful service by the persons in the front desk, a very nice breakfast and very cozy rooms. All at a very reasonable cost. We got very good tips from the persons in the front desk for visiting the City and for a very nice restaurant for dinner, very close by. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: LSCTokyo
Reviews.Content: With an excellent location, friendly, helpful staff, and clean, modern facilities, this is certainly a hotel that is worth the bargain price. The rooms are a bit tight but various creative space saving designs make them functional (I find that a writing desk is absolutely essential, but the combination of a wall-mounted foldaway platform and folding chair met the need, although it was right under the rack for hanging clothes). The construction noise from next door did bother us since we were jet-lagged and needed some sleep during the day, but during the night the back rooms are quiet and once the building next door is finished, this should not be a problem

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: turnerguys
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights - two before our cruise and three after - Dec 2011. The hotel is located a half block off the Ramblas, next to Bouquerie market, a two minute walk from Placa Catalunya and five minutes from the port - perfect for experiencing the best of Baecelona. The rooms were spotlessly clean, the staff friendly and accomodating, and the breakfast was good. We felt right at home! WiHi was available throughout the hotel. The double rooms are small but accomodate two people comfortably for a very reasonable price. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is non- smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Sergi and Mateo are pure gold”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at Hotel Curious for a week while we attended a conference at the University of Barcelona. Both Sergi and Mateo were fantastic, warm and genial hosts who speak fluent English. They were generous with all the very best tips and shortcuts we needed to know in regards to getting around Barcelona. While the room and lift are quite small, this seems to be a European norm rather than unique to Hotel Curious. The bathroom was modern and spotlessly clean and the room was made up each day. Breakfast was ready to go each morning and reflected the room rates and local cuisine. A fantastic location which is a stone's throw from La Ramblas, the Gothic Quarter and the fresh food market. Really though, for me it's all about the people running the joint and the team at Hotel Curious were committed, warm, informative and friendly. Hope to see you and Barcelona again guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- excellent customer serrvice”
Reviews.Author: travelking123
Reviews.Content: Our choice of Hotel Curious was driven off tripadvisor rankings and reviews and I must say we were not disappointed at all. Hotel is located just off La Ramblas- so that noise of La Ramblas is mitigated. However metro stations and most of the Barcelona sites are within a short walking distance. Our triple room was on top floor with a small balcony- which was a bit of disappointment - as there was no view of La ramblas as I was hoping for. But you can't have low noise and a sight of Ramblas together. Wireless internet signal was solid. Room was clean and compact. It did feel a bit claustrophobic for 3 people, but my comparison is to US hotels. Also, I do not understand why all spain hotels have a small shower curtain extending for 1/3rd the length - resulting in spilling of water on bathroom floor. Key factors which stand out is the cheerful and customer oriented attitude of service staff at reception. You can ask them for whatever problem you have - right from planning an itinerary, questions abt barcelona, suggestions on icecream shops and SIM card shops in vicinity, availability of tickets to La Musica, US style wall plug adapters to availability of sharpener for daughter's pencils made blunt while recording her journal. Breakfast is nice and wholesome. It was nice of them to prepare it for us at 5.30 am on day of our departure. We took a cab from airport to hotel which cost us 33 euros in evening (meter showed 26 and 7 euros were added on ). While leaving hotel folks called a cab and that cab charged us 49 euros (meter showed 32 euros and 17 was add on charges). Not knowing spanish , I could not argue, but I would suggest confirming the 'add on ' charges before taking a cab - esp if you are doing it at odd hours. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful, cheap, central”
Reviews.Author: lennie01
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Barcelona, and Hotel Curious was an important factor in our satisfaction with our trip. The breakfast is adequate, the rooms clean and modern, and the staff very friendly. The hotel is steps from La Rambla and on a charming street full of restaurants and inviting shops. Perfect for travellers on a budget. We will recommend to all our friends. The loud noise from nearby construction was indeed a bit annoying (as other travellers have noted), but we didn't spend much time in the hotel during the day, and it was quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: eltez
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a four day stay at the Hotel Curious. We have visited Barcelona several times and booked this hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor - we were not disappointed. Cannot fault anything. Location - just off the Ramblas, a 10 minute walk from the Airport bus stop, round the corner from the famous market. Staff - friendly and helpful. Rooms - adequate size, spotless clean. Breakfast - plentiful cold buffet. Lots of places to eat in the area, we especially enjoyed the Dostrece where for under £50 we had a delicous three course meal with wine and coffee. We are looking forward to our next visit to Barcelona will definately be staying at the Curious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricPonteland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend at the Hotel Curious. VERY helpful staff. Matteo marked a map for us with all of the "must see's" on arrival. Had a problem with the internet in my room at 8 pm one evening. The router on my floor was immediately reset. Superb location 100m from Las Ramblas. Rooms excellent and spotless. If you want an excellent meal at a good price, go to the Hotel Rivoli Ramblas, 200m up Las Ramblas from the Hotel Curious. Get the fixed price menu (17Euro). It includes Starter, Main course, Sweet, bread,water and wine. It's all on the menu board outside!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Elman1952
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stay here based solely on reviews on Trip Advisor. The best feature of this hotel is the staff. They are all very eager to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Just a few of the things they did to help us were: fix an error I made in my reservation; provide aid in using their free internet access; call cabs; store excess luggage; load luggage in cabs; prepare a special breakfast due to our early departure time. Check their rates...they are VERY competitive considering the location about a block and a half from La Rambla. The room was large by European standards, included a balcony overlooking Carrer Carme, and a very European bath. It was lovely. The only negative on the stay was the delivery of construction materials across the street in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Travelpro”
Reviews.Author: Trip-Review01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and 4 other people in November, 2011. After a lot of research, I booked this hotel via the internet. It was a very good choice--located near the cathedral and the Ramblas. The hotel was reasonably priced and very well run and the desk clerks were extremely helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was also very good. The location of the hotel was outstanding--I had stayed in Barcelona twice before, but this location was by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickenfarmersunited
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights, its in a great location, room was quiet at night apart from the building work going on at the back of the hotel, so we didn't need to set an alarm, as they woke us every morning, was very noisy, didn't mind too much as we had things to do in the day, but not good if you want to sleep in, room was tidy and a good size, shower valve was under shower head, which made showering abit awkward as you had to be careful not to turn shower off when showering, only niggle re room, and apart from that was all good, staff are very friendly and all seemed to speak good english and are very helpful with planning days/trips out, perfect location for eating/drinking out, breakfast was fine, same selection every day and was help yourself, room was cleaned daily, shame about building work, but great value though, dont be put off by noise if you are having your days out, and chat to staff about where to go, they can sell you the red and blue bus tickets for a slight discount too, if you want to save on a taxi, its easy and cheap to get a bus back to airport, the hotel staff will tell you where the bus stop is

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel but wait until building works are over..”
Reviews.Author: peace2494
Reviews.Content: This is a great little budget-friendly boutique hotel. The rooms were basic but spotlessly clean, and at a very reasonable rate you get helpful amenities like free wifi and breakfast. However, I just can't recommend this hotel until the building works are finished at the neighboring property. They started promptly at 8 AM everyday (including Saturday) and were literally jackhammering on other other side of the wall from our bed. Let's face it, 8 AM isn't all that early, and we should have been getting up anyway, but it's just not a very pleasant way to start the day when you are on holiday. As I said - there are plenty of positives to this hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the location is perfect for exploring the major sites, and it's great value for money! Just give it a few months until things quiet down...

Reviews.Title: “Clean Tidy and Adequate”
Reviews.Author: leon s
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were all very friendly and the room was clean, tidy and spacious. Lacking inroom tea and coffee making facilities was a slight downside. Sleep during the day was a no go due to the ongoing local building work. But come night time it was peaceful and ideal. Cracking location for La Rambla and all the local attractions. Breakfast was again easy and adequate for a hard days looking around the city sights.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, spotless rooms, yummy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 44vicki44
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with all the wonderful reviews for this hotel and would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone. Its location is perfect just off Las Ramblas and very easy to get to from the airport busstop. Our room was a twin at the front of the hotel and plenty big enough. It was spotless and I love the modern decor. Breakfast was just what we needed, lots of fresh bread, meats and cheese, yoghurts, eggs and fruit - as much as you want. And very impressed at the selection of teas. The staff are happy to make restaurant recommendations but here's one you shouldn't miss - Cerveceria Catalana. The wait was 40 minutes but we put our names down and went for a drink around the corner for half an hour. Also check out Bosc de les Fades (fairy bar) at the end of Las Ramblas on the left hand side next to the wax museum. It's magical! And if you're around on Friday or Saturday evenings go and see the Magic Fountain. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: CIVANOSEATTLE
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the Market, Las Rambles, Tapas restaurants. Friendly staff, perfect English spoken, fair price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jess T
Reviews.Content: having never been to barcelona we didn't know where to go, what to do and where to eat the best paella. We found the delightful team of staff at Hotel Curious to be extremely helpful, freely offering advice. the room was lovely and we enjoyed the free WIFI. the location was perfect! extremely close to Las Ramblas where there is an amazing amount of shopping, food and all the excitement of Barcelona. we had a great time and would not hesitate to stay again at Hotel Curious

Reviews.Title: “Rainy Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Luigia
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at Hotel Curious after an 11 day cruise to the Canary Islands. The hotel is in a great location just steps from La Rambla and the metro. The room is a good size as many hotels in Europe tend to have smaller rooms. The front desk is very friendly and helpful with suggestions on good restaurants and local attractions. We found the continental breakfast served in the morning to be a bonus as well. On the negative side, the bed is a cot and a little on the hard side. Also, there is little storage space in the way of drawers or shelves to lay down clothing. The bathroom also has limited shleving for toileteries, etc. It is really a hotel for a very short stay. A word to the wise. I booked the hotel on their web-site and got a very good rate which was non-refundable. Unfortunately, the airline, Air Transat (that's another story) cancelled our flight. So, I had paid for 3 nights but was only able to stay for 2. I did not hear from the manager although the front desk staff told me that non-refundable means that, no exceptions. So, even though it was out of my hands, I was out of pocket for the one night accomodation. All in all, though for the price, it is an adequate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but very effective!”
Reviews.Author: Kate S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just one night but it was perfect as a central base for exploring the city. The staff are friendly and helpful and for the price the rooms are excellent. It is not a luxury venue but the rooms are clean, comfortable and have everything you need. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Terry W
Reviews.Content: A group of three couples met up for a short break. The rooms are quite small, but the hotel is very close to the Ramblas and the staff are very helpful. The "tourist bus" tour is useful for getting your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: ArmaghApple
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights, so was close to most sights and near metro and buses - very close to ramblas and place catalunya. good breakfast in the morning which was a great start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel very close to Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: FreoBob
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Adviser and once again we were not disapointed. The hotel is friendly, clean and efficient and the location is tremendous. we became very fond of the Mirinda Bar in the square round the corner - happy evenings! I'd been worried by the warnings about pickpocket etc on las ramblas, but with sensible precautions we had no problems at all. A great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the building site next door”
Reviews.Author: RobABalmain
Reviews.Content: This is a very chic, clean hotel with fabulous staff and in a great location just off the Ramblas...HOWEVER at the moment there is a large building site next door that starts working about 8 and finishes at 5 or 6. We stayed in Room 104... On the back right hand side of the building if you view from the front of the hotel... It is extremely noisy... and at times we had people drilling and tapping into our wall... some people say you should be out all day but if you had a three hour lunch after visiting the sites in the morning you may want to crash for a few hours before heading out... We we told on the first afternoon that the hotel was booked and we couldn't move rooms however on the third day after a further complaint we were moved to 206 ... Much better but still noisy. I think the management need to acknowledge that there is a problem and communicate on their website that those who maybe affected by noise should ask for a room that is on the side away from the site and offer discounts for the other rooms. It's interesting when you look at the hotel's website you get a cute video showing the facilities and they are tres chic but small. You get a good breakfast good wi- fi and friendly staff but if you want to relax during the day in your room... With the window open... It's difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: texann
Reviews.Content: Wonderful boutique hotel just off La Rambla! Matteo and the rest of the staff were absolutely wonderful to us during our stay. Our rooms were small but very stylish and comfortable. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “"Clean, Comfortable, and the Best Staff in Barcelona"”
Reviews.Author: born4travlin
Reviews.Content: For anyone who wants clean, comfortable, and the Best Staff in Barcelona this is the hotel for you. I booked this hotel one year ago for a pre cruise stay. From the moment of the booking, Hotel Curious and its wonderful staff promptly answered emails and phone calls with any questions I had regarding our stay. They went out of their way to provide us balcony rooms in view of the LaRamblas. As a person who travels extensively, I look for clean rooms. They beat the mark for clean. They are very modest accomodations compared to the US, but very comfortable. The LaRamblas is at the end of the street, very close and within walking distance. Breakfast is included in the rooom rate and very ample for the start of a day. They even provide service before 8 am for early travelers. Very flexible hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a very comfortable stay for a reasonable rate and an AWESOME Staff. Thanks for the Memories Hotel Curious. We will be back. TJ-Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “One star rating, five star friendliness”
Reviews.Author: Wolfie65
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived,everyone was incredibly helpful and determined that we got the most out of our first visit to Barcelona. The hotel has recently been refurbed and to a good standard. Clean, functional and good value it is a great base for exploring the city. Situated just off Las Ramblas it is a short walk from the Gothic quarter and a slightly longer walk to the harbour. Breakfast was simple but fresh. Going back with friends next year.

Reviews.Title: “Will not hesitate to book again...”
Reviews.Author: ChristyARRRR
Reviews.Content: if I'm still on my budget when returning to Barcelona! Honestly, for what I paid for this room, I definitely got my money's worth, and then some! Not directly on the La Rambla street, it is away from all the noise. The room was small, but again for what I paid, the bed was comfy, the sheets were clean, and the hotel receptionist was always willing and more than happy to help us on our travels. His name was Mateo, and he pointed in the direction of local restaurants--the places were you would be hard-pressed to find on the internet, with menus only in Spanish or Catalan. So if I find myself back in Barcelona and on a budget, this is the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my fiancé for three nights last week. The staff are very nice, extremely helpful and very knowledgeable about where to eat and drink. The hotel is located just 25 mts from Las Ramblas, the rooms were lovely and very clean. For a really good hotel stay here. Claudio and Sergio, thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here based on trip advisor reviews and not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: deeandj
Reviews.Content: Because of all the reviews and photos on trip advisor we knew what the room what look like and that it would be small. Room was clean, staff very friendly and breakfast better than expected. A very good experience. Hotel is in a great loocation and you get to start each day with some great coffee and breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: shanna661
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for 6 nights and stayed here. Wonderful location right down the street form La Rambla. Not a lot of night or morning noise on this street being so close to the main street. Bedrooms were decent size and clean. The beds were not very comfortable though. Breakfast was continental and decent. Free computer use in the lobby. Staff were very friendly and Mateo was very helpful upon our arrival and whenever we had questions. Would stay here again and would recommend to others...

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, comfy room, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jmason63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after our cruise and now we are returning for one more night after our week in Paris. The location is perfect for exploring the gothic quarter and the nearby Metro will get you everywhere else. The staff are excellent and Mateo is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: strawberryeater
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, a small but very comfortable hotel close to the action but surprisingly quiet. Nice, friendly staff who all speak english, and are very attentive. The bteakfast was good and plemtiful, served in the dining room at the back of the hotel by nice staff. Our room was 106 at the back of the hotel, not much of a view but a small balcony for fresh air. Our only small criticism is that the shower room was very small, ours leaked but was to be fixed. They say wifi reaches the whole hotel but our room was so far away from the router that the signal was pretty useless. We would certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pocketsireland
Reviews.Content: The best hotel we've stayed in in a long time,the staff were excellent especially Sergie who went above and beyond the call of duty to make our trip a most enjoyable experience.the hotel is excellently located with good bars and restaurants nearby.I will recomend this hotel to all my friends travelling to Barcelona,Number 1 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Standard room, quality breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Karlie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Curious tries to be hip and fresh, but really it was quite standard to me. Everything was fine, no problems, but everything was just basic. Kind of looks like the décor is all from IKEA. There’s nothing wrong with that, but that’s just what it reminded us of. I was sort of put off right from the start when I was checking in. Having just come from outside, obviously, and being tired and sans makeup, I left my sunglasses on. After talking to the front desk guy for a few minutes, all of a sudden he got all flustered and said he couldn’t talk to people with sunglasses on and that it’s inappropriate, and wouldn’t continue talking to me unless I took them off. I felt like he was scolding me or something and it was really strange. Up until then he had been nice though. The room, again, was basic and fine. The bed was comfortable for me as it was on the soft side. The free breakfast was the highlight for us. Really tasty meats and cheese, hard boiled eggs, croissants, delicious peaches, melon, cereal and yogurt. The hotel is located just off La Ramblas, about a minutes walk. This is good and bad – good because the Metro station is close if you need it, bad because you have to cross that annoying sea of people if you want to get to the other side. If I were ever to happen to stay in Barcelona again, I would give somewhere else a try.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: bensagle
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully sparse yet creative design, with something unheard of in Europe: free wi-fi and breakfast. Helpful, friendly, and personable staff. Great location right near la Ramblas. No hotel parking (public parking nearby). Terrific name. 8/10

Reviews.Title: “I love Spain! Good boutique hotel on busy main plaza street”
Reviews.Author: Sunnnayb
Reviews.Content: First time to spain - started with Barcelona - chose this hotel because of price and proximity to las ramblas - which i was told is the main street - always lively almost 24 hours a day the check in was easy - room was tiny but good for single traveller - the bed was not that comfortable at all. room was clean - had a balcony - no iron or ice machine - have to ask for them from front desk - had breakfast one morning - dont expect anything fancy but did the job. also must be buzzed in when entering and leaving this hotel - would rather be able to swipe in and out whenever - but cant complain..overall good stay. next time i would stay closer to the beach though since that is where i would be all day long! hotel about $20-30 to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “So friendly and decent I kept expecting something to go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Georgerad
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Free wifi, generous bfast, exceptionally helpful staff, fun and tasteful rooms, efficient aircon, spotless bathroom, excellent proximity to restaurants and bars and la ramblas and shops...couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent value....”
Reviews.Author: Phils26
Reviews.Content: Very clean, Spartan, barebones approach. Room is tiny, even for a single person. Two would be a crowd, but location is 40 meters or so from the Rambla, on a quiet side street…so don’t plan on spending much time in the hotel! The bed is super firm, the pillows okay. Air conditioner worked, cooling down to 72 degrees F. Television with no English channels. Single plastic stackable chair. Small “desk” with no drawers. Small ledge beneath a clothes rack, big enough to lay your suitcase on. No closets nor drawers. Tiny bar of soap, no hand towels, paper packet of shampoo. Free continental breakfast with hard boiled eggs, not very tasty croissants, and sliced melons. Why did I like Hotel Curious? 1) Location, location, location! 2) Room is very clean. 3) Mateo behind the desk is charming, welcoming and informative. 4) 2nd floor room in the back had no view, but was quiet as a cemetery for sleep! 5) Free Wi-Fi. All for 90 Euros/night, 83 Euros if reserved a month or so in advance. It’s cheap and located in the best area. Just don’t plan to hang around the hotel; if that’s what you desire, then look elsewhere. Totally agree with those recommending the bus from the airport (5 Euros one way), which has a major bus stop location at Catalunya plaza, a 5 minute walk up La Rambla to the hotel. Many tourists with luggage use this bus, and English is all you need. I had anticipated concerns re safety initially, so I paid about $40 USD one way for an airport taxi on the way in. Took the bus on the way back, and it was easy and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jandj45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated just off Las Ramblas and within easy walking distance of the Metro. The staff were extremely friendly and welcoming, going to gtear trouble to tell us about places we might like to visit, explain how to use public transport, recommending local restaurants etc. The room was small but very well designed; might not have wanted to be there for a long time, but fine for a short sightseeing trip. The breakfast was good - better than we expected for such a reasonably priced hotel. All in all, a very pleasant, convenientplace to stay and extrememly good value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Rob E
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and basic but the location is wonderful, however what makes the Hotel Curious truly special is the excellent, helpful staff. They even got breakfast ready for us earlier than their usual time and had a taxi waiting on our last morning because we were in a hurry. Definitely recommend staying here -- great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “We would choose this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Mulnar
Reviews.Content: The location is just off the Rambles. Very close to the Boqueria Market and the Plaza Catalunya. The hotel is modern furnished, very well kept and clean. The room was not too big, but quiet and with everything we wanted. Surprise was the rich breakfast. All the staff very friendly and helpful. - They really do there best, to make there guests a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigblade
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days in August. The location of the hotel is really good - about two minutes from the Liceu metro station and five from the Plaza Catalunya. The buffet breakfast is good and the staff are friendly and helpful. If you go into some of the back streets in front of the hotel you can find some nice little bars and escape the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room...”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBonita
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Curious is in a fantastic location right off the Ramblas, right around the corner from the Boqueria market. I am a woman and traveled alone to Barcelona and felt completely safe and at ease in this hotel. The front desk service was friendly and effiicient and spoke good English. There was a small glitch when I booked the hotel and they overcharged me by accident but rectified the problem immediately. Not only did they return the overpaid monies but when I arrived at my room there was a lovely box of artisan chocolates waiting for me. I so wanted to give this lovely, modern hotel 5 stars but the single room I was in was so tiny and claustrophobic. There was not even a window; I woke up once in the middle of the night feeling panicky because I felt like I was in a coffin. I would stay at this hotel again but next time I will spend a little extra and stay in a bigger room with a window!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the center. Excellent service. Clean. highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: shaharuty
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the warm, smiling and helpful service. We never got better service at a hotel. The receptionist was always willing to help, recommend routes and restaurants. There is no doubt Sergei is what we will always remember from Barcelona. The room was a bit small - it's the only minus. The rooms are clean,quiet and have air conditioning. good breakfast. And how it is always said: Location, Location, Location! And the price worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: AquaFin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Curious for 4 nights and enjoyed a lot! Single room with a balcony (as requested) was clean and newly furnished. Room was quite small, but had a high ceiling and very smart furnishing for a small room. Bed was just perfect and AC worked well. Also free WiFi-connection in the room, great! The hotel staff was very kind, helpful and professional. One evening I asked for a suggestion of good local restaurant nearby and got directions to a very nice small cellar-restaurant just few blocks away. The hotel was situated just few minutes walk off Rambla, so far enough from the touristic mayhem and close enough to basicly walk almost everywhere. Also bus stops and subway were just around the corner. I took the Aerobus from the airport to the hotel and the Aerobus stop was at Placa Catalunya, 5 minute walk to the hotel. I was very pleased with this hotel and will recommend it to my friends also!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly services”
Reviews.Author: ChuBrazil
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel well located close to La Rambla. Rooms are clean, modern, small but confortable. The hotel offers single, double and triple rooms. I stayed at a single one. When I checked in, I was informed that my room was too small to stay the whole week (as I booked), and that they would provide a new room the following day - promise delivered, and I got a nice room with a balcony. Rest of the group stayed at a triple room, also with a balcony facing the street. There is a decent breakfast (included), 24h desk, and friendly staff speaking different languages. Could get good tips from the staff (about the subway, restaurants nearby, and the city tour bus). Many Barcelona's attractions are within walking distance from the hotel. Except for the size of the rooms - which was not a problem for me - the hotel is a very good choice to stay for a few days in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a leisure trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: therisks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family group for 3 nights in a double and a twin. Absolutely perfect location for a stay in Barcelona in a reasonably quiet and picturesque street just off La Rambla. 5 minute walk to the Cathedral and Place de la Catalunya. Many restaurants and other sights within walking distance. The rooms were basic but spotless and the beds comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful, providing lots of advice about places to visit. The continental buffet breakfast is simple but more than adequate. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It should be called "Hotel Fabulous"”
Reviews.Author: ABroadAbroad
Reviews.Content: Yes, the decor is self-consciously minimalist and trendy. Yes, there's usually only one person at the front desk. Yes, it presents itself as a one-star budget hotel. But Hotel Curious is the best place I've ever stayed in Barcelona. It's in a fantastic location on a quiet street right off La Ramblas. Its modest rooms are simple (with folding chairs, hanger racks for clothes, and tables that fold out of the walls) but quiet, chic, and comfortable with excellent showers and air-conditioning. The bathrooms are spanking clean. There are generous free breakfasts. And the service is absolutely stupendous. Everyone who worked the front desk during our four-day stay was superb: friendly, helpful, patient. I have absolutely nothing negative to say. We slept beautifully, we loved staying here, and we'll be back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, simple charm”
Reviews.Author: PixKris
Reviews.Content: By happy accident, I ended up with two days in Barcelona at the end of another trip. I was on my own, and I looked here for ideas about an economical place to stay in the city that would be friendly to a solo female traveler who spoke limited Spanish and Catalan. Hotel Curious was perfect. The staff was so accommodating, getting my room done early so I could shower and change, offering me an overview of the city and tips for getting around (in flawless English), and even getting up early to provide me some breakfast before I had to leave at 5:30 in the morning. I can’t say enough about them. The rooms are small and basic, but they are very clean and decorated nicely in IKEA’s best. My mattress was a bit hard, but I didn’t expect luxury . The location of the hotel is perfect. Not only are you close to the main tourist attractions, a block off La Rambla and Barri Gotic, you are also close to the clean and convenient Metro system. I got a two-day unlimited Metro card and saw everything I wanted to see in the limited time I had. This is a great hotel for those travelers who want to stay in the heart of the action but don’t care about extra amenities, and I’d also recommend it to English speakers worried about setting off alone in the city. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: travalbuddy
Reviews.Content: This place has it spot on for a budget hotel. The rooms are a decent size and the room and ensuite were both spotless. The location is also brilliant being only a maximum 5 minute walk from la rambla; you don't get all the noise at night so you can get a peaceful sleep and yet you're within spitting distance of lots of great little tapas restuarants and sights. Our room had a balcony which is also nice and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. I recommend this place very highly!!

Reviews.Title: “Our #1 hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BobbyHank
Reviews.Content: Located near Plaça de Catalunya and a half-block off of Ramblas, we found Hotel Curious on a a side street offering a quiet escape but easy access to the excitement of Barcelona and the great tastes of a local market of primarily fresh fruit vendors. More importantly, the staff of Hotel Curious went out of their way providing us with helpful information about the area, offering a discount card for local restaurants and merchants, assisting in airline and taxi reservations, and opening their delicious breakfast buffet an hour early so we could enjoy it before taking an early morning flight. The accommodations were comfortable and priced fairly; the service and hospitality exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: lhsmithdds
Reviews.Content: Hotel Curious is a very clean basic hotel in an excellent location just a short walk from the Ramblas and about a 10 minute walk to buses and metro. The front desk staff was always helpful. We had a triple room and it was tiny but the price was just right. Three beds, 2 folding chairs, wall table and a bar for hanging clothes left little room for walking around. However, with so much to do in Barcelona, we just wanted a clean hotel in a good location for sleeping and that is exactly what we got!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KateandRod
Reviews.Content: Great location near La Ramblas, very handy for eating out and sightseeing. Very clean, and the staff were extrememly helpful in telling us about the city, and how to get around. The only reservation was that our double room was smaller than we were expecting, although our sons' twin room was great, and there isn't much space for storing clothes except in the suitcase and on a few hangers. This doesn't detract from it being an excellent find and very highly recommended. Watch out for pickpockets everywhere! I hadn't seen the Sagrada Familia since 1997 - it was stunning!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect option for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Anya_Ukr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Curious for 3 days during my 'tourist' visit to Barcelona. Overall I am very satisfied with the hotel. Location is excellent for sightseeing - next to La Rambla, La Boqueria Market and Liceu subway station, few steps to Catalunia (where the airport bus stops). Though being so centrally located, it is surprisingly quiet (and I'm a light sleeper). Hotel offers complimentary breakfast (simple but tasty) and high-speed WiFi. And the best thing about the place is its staff - both reception and kitchen people are extremely friendly and helpful. The best hotel staff I've experienced so far. On the downside - the room is so small, that there's literally no room for proper wardrobe and storage. All I had in my single room was two little drop tables with a shelf (unreachable high) and some hangers above them (which means all the long things you hang will have their bottoms lying on the tables) and a tiny bedside table. That was totally OK for my short visit, but if you're in Barcelona for longer than, let's say/ a week, you might need a bit more room to arrange your clothes/shoes and other staff. Besides that, room and bathroom were very nice, new and clean. Oh, and there also was a little balcony facing the backyard - I suppose, for the smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: kenw15
Reviews.Content: A modern small smart basic hotel in downtown Barcelona, 50 yards from the Ramblas. Great location for walking, and well served by cheap buses and underground. The desk person really helped us with maps and ticket advice. All you need. If you are traveling to Barcelona by car: This hotel has no car park (probably true of most small hotels in the city). There are underground parking places very near the hotel but - at 28 Euros/day. Of course a car is useless in Barcelona - there is nowhere on the street to park! So your car will stay parked the whole time you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Be curious”
Reviews.Author: Red_Flashpacker
Reviews.Content: Fantastic facilities, location and staff. Really, our stay could not have been better. Place was very clean and well taken care of. The free breakfast offered each morning (including croissants, bread, cheeses, cured meats, hard boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, coffee, juice, tea...) did not vary, but was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, fair accommodations”
Reviews.Author: MangoPlum
Reviews.Content: Booked at this hotel based on excellent TripAdvisor ratings. Positive attributes cited in reviews are spot on -- excellent location, quiet, clean, very knowledgeable and helpful staff. Room and bathroom, however, were tiny, bed was hard, air conditioner did not function properly. Having recently stayed in much better quality hotels for same price in otehr big European cities (Rome, Paris), I did not feel that this hotel was a particularly good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MaltaMontana
Reviews.Content: With a five night stay booked I wasn't sure if I choose a hotel that I could live with. I had read that the room for a solo traveler was Very small! ~ but what do I need! ~ a clean comfortable room in which to sleep. The Hotel Curious delivers this Plus +++! If you book at least thirty days before your stay you will recieve a 15% discount, for me this turned out to be just over $100 per night (depends on the Euro/dollar exchange). The breakfast provided is above average, but don't expect a US style breakfast. Location alone would make this hotel worth a serious look, walking distance from the main square where train and bus services are located. One could very easily spend two days just visting sites within easy walking distance. I have never stayed in any other hotel in Barcelona so I can not compare. I will say this is the best value of any hotel that I have stayed in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoralieVancouver
Reviews.Content: Hotel Curious is located a very short walk from La Rambla. The hotel is quite modern and very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was simple, but very good and more than sufficient to get your day started. The room was great, very functional and the artwork on the wall was incredible. We started our honeymoon at this hotel and immensely enjoyed our stayed there. The Curious team made our honeymoon stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a gem & a bargain with a great location”
Reviews.Author: scarfdoggy
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We were a family of 3 with a teenager in a triple room. The hotel staff was very responsive to a number of email inquiries. While small by American standards, the room was simple, very clean and well insulated. When we checked in, the manager gave us a map and took the time to explain the city attractions and locations to us. The breakfast included in the cost of our room was lovely - fresh fruit, croissants & bread, juices, yogurt, cereal, cheese, cold cuts, coffee & tea. The hotel's location is perfect - not right on La Rambla but just a couple of minutes from it. It was an easy walk with our luggage from Plaza Cataluyna. Our only complaints are that the rooms do not have safes (although the front desk offered to lock anything for us) and the frosted bathroom door didn't provide as much privacy as we would have liked. However, having said that, we will definitely stay at this hotel again when we return to Barcelona. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing time at Hotel Curious”
Reviews.Author: stacio44
Reviews.Content: Just back from Barcelona and enjoyed Hotel Curious very much. The front desk staff was warm and helpful - always had a map and a suggestion for you. Caren was especially helpful about where to eat! The front desk staff is manned 24 hours a day and they buzz you in, which I liked very much. It is a very clean,quiet, serene hotel just off the bustling Rambla. There is an elevator which was fine. Very close to Liceu train station and could walk to many major sites. Not much in the room & room is small, but bed was comfortable, they gave us extra pillows, shelves pulled down for our luggage, good stall shower. Continental breakfast is included, great strong coffee. The one improvement I would make is to change up breakfast once in a while. It was the same exact fruit and cereals and meats every day. I will also say that they were doing some construction in the building next door and during the weekdays they started at 8:00 am. It wasn't very loud, but it did wake us up one morning. They held our luggage on our last day and arranged for a cab to the airport (30 euros). Free wireless internet in rooms and lobby.

Reviews.Title: “quite new, unknown but reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Julie1266
Reviews.Content: It was the first time to stay in Barcelona and we stayed from June 26 to July 2. Price, cleanliness, location(!!) were very satisfying. Breakfast was very good. Wifi was working very well. The room is not big but very functional. But there was a renovation right next to the hotel so the sound was annoying only in the morning. But the noise didn't go long anyway. We were on our honeymoon and staff prepared a chocolate box on the bed. How sweeeeet!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a great location and we loved our stay.”
Reviews.Author: teacher4847
Reviews.Content: Our stay was such as pleasure.. The staff was helpful, the place was impeccibly clean, all the frest fruit, meats and croissants at breakfast was a treat each morning. Someone even prepared breakfast for us at 5:30 AM due to an early flight. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “in the barrio”
Reviews.Author: maris09
Reviews.Content: have to say hotel curious was a pleasant surprise. asked for a quiet ,exterior single roomand that's what gave me. room was small but super clean, with a small balcony. for being in the middle of the city the room was very quiet at night. even though there was no real view from the balcony still it was nice to open the balcony door and get some fresh air at night. the wifi was awesome. had my ipad with me. the staff really great. and the breakfast buffet a great way to start the day. have to say if your looking for hilton type hotel this is not the place. but if you want a place in the center of it all at good value then look no further.

Reviews.Title: “We would definately recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Jadethecat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off Las Ramblas, making it convenient to many tourist, shopping and dining options. The rooms are not luxurious, but they were clean and functional. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful; they provided directions, suggestions for places to visit, made dinner and taxi reservations for us and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They even offered to make us breakfast before leaving on an early morning flight. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service and ideal for a budget stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TheStaples
Reviews.Content: Boys (we were boys, but we are now nearly 40) trip to Barcelona. Hotel is just off las ramblas, walking distance from place de la catalynua where the airport tube / bus drops off. It's a small hotel, and although relatively basic its very clean, well run, has everything groups or couples need, was quiet (we weren't noisy), had free breakfast which was OK and i would recommend it for any groups / couples / singles on a budget - it's the best you are gonig to get for your money.

Reviews.Title: “New small boutique hotel in a great location which was value for money”
Reviews.Author: JenBurke_23
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Curious. The booking was made through their website and included breakfast. The hotel was modern and refurbished. Our room had a balcony and was well air-conditioned. The wifi in the room worked fairly well. The location was great - right next to La Rambla, and in the El Raval area with lots of bars and restaurants. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: CardiffDawn
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights from june 30th in room 306. the hotel was very clean and the hotel staff very friendly,the breakfast was fine with plenty to eat and a good choice. the bedroom was ok,a bit minimal just a bed,1 folding chair,tv,2 lamp tables and some open hanging space for clothes,the bathroom was good very clean and a decent shower. our problem was that we had a back room which i had understood to be facing a courtyard,but it faced a really run down apartment block,which was maybe 10 feet away and to be honest was a real slum so that was your view should you look out or venture out onto the what would have been nice but for this balcony,it had to be far by the hotel been or tried to be sheltered by a trellis of fake ivy floor to ceiling,but that was our only downer,so that if we stayed at hotel courious again we would only take a front of hotel room. there was a lot of noise from 8am with the workmen remodelling the building next door,not hotel courious fault,but something else to consider and it looks like it will take a long time to finish. so hotel,staff and room all good just back rooms a definate no.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable hotel, with even better service”
Reviews.Author: Geodyssey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Curious before and after a recent cruise. We were greeted like family by the staff, who were very helpful in recommending things to do and places to eat. Mateo, who was at the front desk when we checked in was especially helpful, as was the woman who worked the shift after Mateo in the afternoon (but didn't wear a nametag so I don't know her name). The rooms are a bit small, but very comfortable and clean, and the included breakfast was very good. There is free internet and wireless at the hotel, so we were able to stay connected to family back home. The hotel is located a short walk from Las Ramblas and the La Boqueria market, and we walked from the hotel through the Gothic District, to La Sagrada Familia, and the waterfront. There are several good restaurants within a short walk from the hotel. Finally, the price was much more affordable than other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you pay for: clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: sazmcphee
Reviews.Content: Great location just off Las Ramblas, with lots of transport options close by. The room wasn't very big, but was clean and had a nice ensuite bathroom, air conditioning and free wifi. The breakfast included in the price was decent with a large array of options (pastries, ham, cheese, fruit, yoghurt, cereal and toast). All in all a great deal in central Barcelona, with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerABC
Reviews.Content: In early June, we stayed there for 2 days on either side of a cruise that departed from Barcelona. The hotel offered exactly what one expected - nice, clean room with comfortable decor and bed, at a reasonalbe price. Breakfast was adequate. The hotel is very close to the busy Rambla but is's on a small side street so it's not noisy at all. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We weren't sure which terminal our cruise ship was docked. Staff wuickly searched the internet then called the cruise liner to get the exact location for us. We stored some luggages there while we're on cruise, and there were no problems or hussltes at all. Overall, a nice, convenient and decent hotel that offers good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The true added value: Kindness”
Reviews.Author: zosigma
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location (30 meters from La Rambla) that looks lovely at first sight. The double room where we stayed was a bit small but very functional, clean and modernly decorated. Bathroom had a great shower. The real value added are the great person that work at Curious Hotel. Special mention for Mateo who was so nice to lend me a hanger for my dress when we left. He saved me with this little gesture.... Thanks again! I will look forward to come back soon! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Fast internet, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: heavylunch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after our cruise. It was 25 Euro to get from the port to the hotel for 4 people and bags. It was 50 Euro to get to the airport. The hotel was convientient to La Ramla and the Barcelona Cathedral. We used the hotel internet to check into our flights. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful for our one night here.

Reviews.Title: “Soooo amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: MarinaGarner
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. Me and my mother programed a trip to Barcelona and this hotel seemed ideal since it is not at all expensive for the great location it is at! And we were not disappointed!!! The hotel is impeccable in cleanness and service. The rooms are so cute and have everything you need. The service was great, they had the best recommendations and were extremely helpful with everything we needed taking a long time researching stuff for us and reserving restaurants. The hotel is SOO close to all the great places but still has the peace and quiet of a small parallel street. I will definitely be back to this hotel when I have the privilege of going back to Barcelona. What a city!!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent find”
Reviews.Author: foodloverBridgnorth
