Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through the reviews on trip advisor and it is a good find.The location is super you can walk to a lot of the main sites easily.The hotel is basic but very clean lovely shower room and I have stayed in far more expensive hotels and not had the choice of breakfast.The buffet was constantly being topped up so no stale food.The staff were all very friendly and gave loads of information made reservations in restaurants kept luggage on last day so would highly recommend.Wi Fi also worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Linda248
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I chose this hotel from internet reviews and were not disappointed. The rooms were fair size for Europe and very clean. The location was excellent, right off La Rambla so it was quite but very close to everything. The breakfast was good and had a good selection. It was also included in the price of the room which was reasonable. The staff was very helpful and friendly. If we return to Barcelona we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Fabulous Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Aeryn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Curious was a great find! While it does not have the services/frills of a higher star hotel, it does what it does exceedingly well. I stayed in a single room which was small but very clean and had nice decor. The bed was not fancy but I slept well in the room. While only about 50 metres from the Ramblas, there was no noise in the hotel room at all. The street the hotel is on looks a bit dubious but it is well trafficked both during the day and at night and only a few metres from the Ramblas which is always full of people. The hotel is very secure. The reception staff buzz you in and the hotel is small enough they know who you are in no time. As a solo female traveller I had no qualms about my safety either in the hotel or walking to the hotel even in the evenings. The hotel is really nicely maintained and the decor is modern. Free wifi was great and breakfast (continental) was also done well. The real stand out though were the staff. Very friendly and helpful. They printed out my boarding passes for my flights home, booked my taxi for the next morning and, as I was leaving before breakfast is put on, organised a selection for me to have before I left. The one thing I would have liked was an in-room safe which seemed to be standard at almost all the hotels I stayed in while travelling in Spain but was not in this hotel. I didn't have any concerns about the safety of my belongings in the room, I'm just used to using them as an added precaution. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a good value option in the Ramblas area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. Not an 1star hotel after all”
Reviews.Author: CStefanou
Reviews.Content: Renovated Nice rooms A little bit noisy Nice breakfast not great variety Free wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jmapelle_Sofi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Curious was a good find. I liked the fact that it was clean and tidy. The security was quite good, considering it was in the heart of Las Ramblas. The reception was always lovely. Breakfast wasnt great but much better to enjoy the food of Barcelona outside of a hotel. The room was small, but we didnt mind it much. No security/safe box within the room was the only real disadvantage but other than this, we enjoyed it. Very much a city room, not a beach/resort/spa style stay. Would recommend for others to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rlr316
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice in May, once for a night before embarking on a Med cruise, then also 2 nights post cruise. The staff was very helpful in holding our luggage as needed so we could continue to sightsee the day of the cruise after we had checked out and before our room was ready on our return. They were also helpful in assisting us to figure out how to get places via public transport. The rooms were clean and basic, but the bathrooms we had were nice. We had street facing first floor rooms on each stay, and the street noise wasn't bad. It is on a sidestreet a half block from the Ramblas so doesn't get a lot of traffic. We were able to take the aeroport bus from Plaza Cataluyna very easily by wheeling our suitcases about 10 minutes from the hotel up the Ramblas to the plaza. The airport bus was 5.30 euros each where a taxi would have been at least 30 euros. Make sure you know whether you're going to terminal 1 or 2, since the buses are designated by terminal but leave from the same point. Also, you can take a port bus before or after a cruise to the cruise terminal at the bottom of the Ramblas near the Columbus column. It was 2 euros each way (can get a lower roundtrip price) and not too far a distance with wheeled luggage up to the hotel. There is a large church at the corner of Carme and the Ramblas which makes a good landmark for finding the hotel again. There was a computer with internet access available to guests. Good breakfast included in price.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: chris3101
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hotel Curious last Saturday after week in Aiguablava. The hotel was perfect! The situation is ideal to explore Barcelona - in fact as we were short of time we used the open top tourist bus from Catalunya Square a very short walk away. This was by far the best way to see it all in a day - fantastic value too 23 euros for 2 x 2 hour trips taking in all the sights. The receptionist Caroyn was so helpful, nothing was too much trouble and we felt that we mattered to her. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the rooms delightful. Each floor is themed by one of the elements. We were on the 1st floor, (water) overlooking the road so we had a small balcony. The decor of the room was fabulous with shades of cream and sage green throughout. Very modern, with dark grey wooden laminate floor and slate tiles in the bathroom. Very tasteful. It was very quite at night despite the biggest street party ever in La Ramblas after Barcelona won the champions cup - what an experience to be there then though. Overall a really lovely positive experience and I would have no hesitattion in recommending this hotel to any of my family/friends and would definately stay at this hotel if we go back to Barcelona. Superb value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Trust the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: alwoh
Reviews.Content: Clean, well located, very helpful desk staff, very adequate breakfast. Beds are ok - not great. Free wi-fi, and computer for guest use.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Scootchy69
Reviews.Content: You could not get better service, cleaner rooms, a more helpful staff than you get here at Hotel Curious! They answered every question and mapped out everything to see and do on a map for us! The rooms are so clean and just what you need for a short stay in Barcelona! The location gives it a nice quiet atmosphere to catch up on the sleep missed from a long flight! It is toward the middle of the Las Ramblas area so it is close to everything. We would definitely stay here again. There is no exercise facilities or pool or spa but we never use those anyways...we have everything we need and a very pleasant staff as well!! Thank you for a pleasant and enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location close to Las Ramblas Street”
Reviews.Author: deepakag14
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is its location close to the happening street of Las Ramblas. Can be reached conveniently by metro stop Liceu. It is in the street Carme connecting to Las Ramblas, so there is no noise. Rooms are quite and comfortable, however small. Bathrooms are small but clean and separate. Hotel staff is very much helpful with good English. Lift is very small to discourage the persons with large baggage. Breakfast variety is limited, however sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Spain”
Reviews.Author: Charlielin
Reviews.Content: I'm happy to choose Hotel Curious as my final lodging choice in BCN. Reasonable price at accessible location, helpful staff, good room size as compared with other hotels in europe, wonderful breakfast (with various choices in fruits/ ham/ bread), high speed wifi everywhere in the hotel,etc. I spent a total of 4 nights there - for the start & end point for my visit in spain. Yes, the shower tube is a bit small. But it's very common in europe hotel. Absolutely good value to money than those "boutique" hotels that costed over EUR 200 in Seville/ Cordoba/ Granada.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: muggs1016
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, just off La Rambla!! The rooms and the hotel was very clean. The front desk staff was very helpfull in pointing out points of interest that may be worth checking out. The breakfast was excellent and was in plentifull supply. The only criticism we have is the lack of an ice machine. We had to buy ice at a store nearby and had to leave the bag of ice with the front desk and had to go back to them each time we wanted some of our ice. This hotel should buy an ice machine.

Reviews.Title: “The staff bend over backwards to ensure that guests get the most from a visit to the hotel and to Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: phillieflyers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel twice during a two week trip beginning and ending in Barcelona. While the rooms are small and basic, they are extremely functional and we were able to store six bags and still had plenty of space to get around the room. The breakfast is substantial and on both of our stays the staff offered us breakfast more than an hour before the usual starting time of 7:30 so that we could make early flights. The staff is wonderful! They go out of their way to make sure that guests get everything possible from the facilities of the hotel and from the city of Barcelona. Thanks again Mateo, Katrina, & Sergi.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with family, without having to sit around and visit.”
Reviews.Author: traveld0t
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Curious for 3 nights prior to embarking on a cruise ship and 1 day after disembarking. So 4 nights. We choose Hotel Curious because of the reviews on Trip Advisor, the reasonable price, and the fantastic location. Upon arrival we were met by Mateo, after taking care of checking in. Mateo pulled out a map of Barcelona and spent 10 to 15 minutes circling points of interest around the city while giving us a small history lesson. Mateo let us know that he and Hotel Curious were there for us, to make our stay safe and enjoyable. He was great! As was all the staff. Breakfast was generous with eggs, yogurt, cheese and meats, prepared fruits, assorted breads and pastries, cereals, coffee, tea, juice and milk. The hotel was spotless, as was our room. Free WIFI, and a computer for our use in the main lounge. Plus a machine that dispensed pop and beer,for a cost. Our room was small, but very efficient, with a balcony overlooking the street. We slept like babies every night. The location was a very quick 1 minute walk to Las Ramblas and into the Barri Gotic neighborhood. There were bakeries and bars and restaurants very close. Unless you want a Antique , Baroque looking hotel, Hotel Curious is very Modern and GREEN. You cannot beat the Service, Price or Location. We loved Barcelona and will be staying at Hotel Curious again. Gracias, Ruth Mackey

Reviews.Title: “Made our stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Miffle
Reviews.Content: We can't recommend Hotel Curious enough for people travelling to Barcelona. The hotel was exactly what we needed for our four day trip. The room was lovely and very clean, and the location is second to none being right in the heart of the city. We found that everything was within walking distance, and so we very quickly felt at home. We must also give a special mention to Sergi, who was so helpful every day with recommendations for good restaurants, sightseeing trips and so on. It was great to see a friendly face at the end of each day. The price of accommodation was a bargain really, and we would certainly stay again if returning to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for short trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: WaterfordCat
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception staff - helpful & friendly. Hotel feels very safe & central location for Las Ramblas. Liked the modern decor & beds were very comfortable! Free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get here from the airport, great city location, clean”
Reviews.Author: Soda100
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Curious has a funny name, but it's a great place to stay. Very clean, very comfortable, a great value for the money, and a friendly staff. I stayed there at the start of my trip to Barcelona, and wanted to stay there at the end of it as well, but there was a mix-up in the reservations, and the friendly staff found me a room at a sister property close by, which was helpful since it was a busy weekend and the hotels were otherwise booked up. The staff were always helpful and courteous, and had good suggestions for helping me to arrange my day. I spoke either Spanish or English, and their English was fine. What I like most about the hotel is how simple and straightforward everything is, geared towards guest comfort. The room was spotless, and there's a handy area to hang your clothes, as well as a well-marked recycling area for your disposables-- it's nice to have this feature. It's decorated in a tidy, comfortable IKEA style, but the lights are placed in all the right places and the shower is very comfortable. Breakfast is bread, coffee, tea, yogurt, cheese, jam, and ham, and the area is well-maintained. There's also free wireless in the hotel, as well as a little station downstairs. The room I was in was not particularly big, but it was arranged comfortably and I had a little balcony to sit on. It's in a residential street off of LaRambla, which is lively at all hours, so it's nice to get a little quiet time at the hotel. It's just a 2 minute walk from LaRambla, and it's around the corner from the Boqueria, and within walking distance to many shops and theaters. There's also two small grocery stores nearby if you'd like to pick up bottled water, and a good bakery for snacks. The area around the hotel is safe, though I had been warned it gets less nice a few more blocks away from LaRambla, but it is perfectly fine to walk around in the evenings near the hotel. Very handy: it's a quick walk to the Plaza Catalunya, where the airport bus stops. So you can get to the hotel for a couple of Euros by bus, if you want to save taxi fare. It's also very close to the Metro, which is a great way to get around the city. My stay at the Hotel Curious felt like a great way to get in to the city, clean, quiet, comfortable, and well-located.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel makes a nonsense of the star system !”
Reviews.Author: HilaryMS
Reviews.Content: I was interested to see what a one star hotel was like, as I don't think I have ever stayed in one before! I was also a little worried that it might not live up to the excellent website! However, our stay at the Hotel Curious was everything you could wish for in a city hotel. It was very clean and minimalist in decoration, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom spotless, the breakfast good and the staff excellent. All the rooms have a huge black and white photo filling the wall behind the bed of a Barcelona landmark. As we were busy charging around Barcelona during the daytime and dining out in the many excellent tapas bars and restaurants in the surrounding area at night, we only spent a small time in the hotel, but it is that sort of hotel that caters to the tourist to Barcelona. The bed is there when you want it, the staff are there when you have a question and the breakfast is there when you are hungry - what more do you need? On top of this, this very techy hotel has free Wifi in the bedrooms and a PC for guests use in the reception. The only negative comment I had was that there was sometimes a smell of cigarette smoke in the reception, which I expect came from smokers who were standing outside the hotel having a cigarette. Nevertheless, a very small comment in a perfect weekend, which the Hotel Curious played a big part ! This one star hotel gets 4 stars from us !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: 255100Jenny
Reviews.Content: We thought Hotel Curious was wonderful. It is easy to find and in a fantastic location. We felt safe in this little side street full of character and close to La Ramblas, restaurants, metro, shopping, the market. The hotel and the rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. The bathroom seemed new and had a bath. Breakfast was good and available from 8 til 11. All the staff were friendly and helpful, and there is a computer to use in the lobby. We stayed in a triple room which over looked the street and with the window shut it was so quiet we were surprised to see the hotel was fully booked. I would recommend visiting the restaurants on their Curious Card as they are really good and happy to give the discounts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: da33Melbourne
Reviews.Content: This is in a quiet street right in the heart of it all. Clean rooms and trendy. Hotel staff very helpful. We even got chocolates for our honeymoon. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ChChCh1981
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful reception staff, nice clean rooms, and the location was perfect - off in the side streets so quiet, but 30 seconds walk to the main boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception, excellent location at a quiet street just off La Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: idleworm
Reviews.Content: Sort of a boutique hotel (every floor has a colour theme). Rooms are simple, well designed, clean, new and very cosy. Every floor is reachable by elevator. Comes with free wifi access. The reception was pretty good from my room (level 3). You're greeted with a hearty "ola" each time you pass by the reception. Staff are friendly and helpful. The warm reception in many ways beat those of higher star hotels. That's the good thing about small establishments. It's somehow more personal. Breakfast was buffet-style with a generous serving of cold cuts, bread, cereals, fruits and all. Location was of course excellent. Located along a quiet street just off La Ramblas. So, u have best of both worlds. A restful night and close access to almost anything. So, if you're looking for a simple, cosy place that is very centrally located, Hotel Curious is an excellent choice. Would definitely come back again when I'm in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Value but little comfort”
Reviews.Author: Ruperto
Reviews.Content: Avoid the single bedrooms around the lift shaft...not enough room to swing a mouse and no fresh air. Double rooms with outside windows seem better. Generally this is a budget hotel with no amenities, but its clean, hospitable, and provides a basic breakfast. The location is great for rambla-ing, and the market. Not so good for taxi service from the airport. I'm 55 so for younger folk this is probably a greater bet. Staff at reception are great.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: bridie100
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, comfy bed, extremely friendly & helpful staff and the cleanest hotel we've stayed in! Only downside was noise from other rooms - my partner is a light sleeper & was kept awake by someone with a bad cough in the room next door! But no noise disturbance from outside - we had a double room at the back of the hotel. Location, cleanliness and lovely staff make up for the lack of sound-proofing! Would definitely recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stuff”
Reviews.Author: MaxWilko
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. The room was spotlessly clean, modern and comfortable, with plenty of space to hang clothes. The shower was very good. Breakfast was generous and there was a choice of cereal, toast, croissant, egg, fruit, cheese and meats. The location was fantastic and very close to two metro stops. Above all else, the staff were polite, friendly and very helpful. Especially Sergi, who found our bus timetable for us as we panicked about how we'd make our early flight home from Gerona. All in all, an excellent choice for a trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Barcelona stay”
Reviews.Author: Tyrarex2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week and a half in Barcelona and were extremely glad that we stayed at Hotel Curious. The location is ideal; s five minute walk from Plaza Catalunya and even closer to the Liceu stop on the Metro. It is very close to the Rambla, but usually quiet enough to sleep, especially on the upper floors. It was a very short walk to the Barcelona Catedral, as well as many other sights in the Barri Gotic. The huge Boqueria market is behind the hotel and connected by a convenient alley. We enjoyed fresh fruit and snacks there almost every day. There are plenty of bakeries, markets and restaurants nearby. It would be very difficult to starve in Barcelona. Breakfast was very convenient and while the choices were a bit limited, there was always a variety of yogurts, breads, meats, cereals, fruits and hot and cold beverages. The staff was kind enough to allow early breakfast on days when we had to out early to catch a train or get to the airport. The staff was multi-lingual, very friendly and helpful. The free internet access in the lobby was great and almost always available without having to wait very long. We had a double room. The beds were comfortable and while the room was not huge, there was enough space to open our luggage and settle in. Face it, you don't go to Barcelona to spend your time in a hotel room anyhow. The bathroom was nice and clean with good lighting and plenty of hot water. The elevator was small, but we rarely had to wait long for it to arrive. Incidentally, we went out of town for an overnight trip and were able to leave most of our luggage in their secure storage, which was a great convenience. The hotel offers its Curious Card (it's free) and we did find it helpful to get some small discounts at a nearby bakery and the Chocolate shop down the street. The restaurants they listed looked good and attracted good-sized crowds, although we didn't get to any of them. We were really glad that we picked Hotel Curious; a choice heavily influenced by reviews on Trip Advisor. We would like to return to Barcelona in a few years to see some of the sights that were closed or that we just didn't have enough time to visit. When we do, we will definitely plan to stay at Hotel Curious again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Mateo!”
Reviews.Author: jdr1210
Reviews.Content: When I travel the ideal trip is one where I have a knowledgeable friend in the city. Stay in this comfortable little hotel 1 block off La Rambla and Mateo, the daytime manager/ receptionist is that friend instantly. The local knowledge he cheerfully shares in 5 going on 6 languages is priceless. I have yet to meet the Ritz Carlton concierge who can match his gracious assistance. The rooms are bright and clean. You are smaller than I and I could shower with a bit if caution. Hot water galore, firm mattress, 2 blocks to La Boqueria and Mateo all for a modest price. Want to spend more? OK but you won't get better value. Location or Mate for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: cf778
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as good as it gets for a reasonable price. The location could not be much better, the price I paid was very reasonable, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly and the breakfast was very good. If you are traveling to Barcelona on a budget, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive !”
Reviews.Author: BACIO75
Reviews.Content: Very clean and very cosy hotel. Simple but amazing. 5 minutes from Las Ramblas and within the walking distance to best of Barcelona. The stuff is very friendly and helpfull. Best value for money ! All vising Barcelona go for it ! Best Regard to Matteo at the reception of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with Hotel Curious”
Reviews.Author: rimsky7
Reviews.Content: found Hotel Curious completely satisfying. liked the location. very good breakfast. all of the desk staff were accomodating and Caryn made some excellent restaurant recommendations. rooms were big enough and clean. would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful haven in the centre of the city!”
Reviews.Author: CJTGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We visitied this newly refurbished hotel for 2 nights from 18th March 2011. There were 3 of us in one room but there was adequate space and storage for our short stay. (Would need to take a few hangers of your own if you were there for longer! Also no drawers - but a shelf quite high up to put your 'smalls' and t shirts) The place was spotless, a good shower, toiletries, balcony, hairdryer, phone and free wi-fi, which was very useful. (Also a computer in the foyer that could be used free of charge) The staff went out of their way to help whenever they could, advising on restaurants and places to visit. Also put our passports in the safe for duration of our stay. We were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the breakfast - not just croissants and juice! (Served from 8-11am!) There was a good selection of cold meats, cheese, eggs, fresh fruit, cereal, juice, yoghurts and breads/pastries. Also a toaster and a toasted sandwich maker if you fancied a cheese and ham toastie! A fantastic start to the day. We left our cases with reception, locked and marked securely, while we spent our last day sight-seeing until the time to leave. The hotel is located just off Las Ramblas. The airport bus took 25 mins to get into the city (Place de Catalunya - at the top of Las Ramblas) and then it was just a 5-10 min walk down to the hotel. Brilliant location and superb hotel - would highly recommend this to everyone visiting the city - especially for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: dbiwoodstockvt
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Hotel Curious and could not have made a better choice. The location, steps from The Rambla and la Bouqueria is excellent and the value, based upon room, amenities, and service, is top notch. We were greeted by a friendly staff that could not do enough in order to make our stay special (Matteo is a gem!). The small, boutique hotel atmosphere makes it feel like coming home every evening. The breakfast was also very good with ample seating, fresh foods, and a braod array of choices. We could not have found a better place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly and Courteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveler56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Curious for 2 nights pre-cruise. The location is excellent - a few blocks from Placa Catalunya. It is very easy to take the Aerobus from the airport (5.05 euros) to Placa Catalunya, and then walk to the hotel. The rooms are basic, but clean. Breakfast is included, and consists of quite a variety of foods to choose from: cold cereal, bread, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, meats, cheeses, hard cooked eggs. The hotel has free Wifi. The hotel staff was outstanding. They were so very helpful, and gave excellent directions to points of interest, as well as best modes of transportation, etc. A very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing price!”
Reviews.Author: reebster
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a modern feel with a great location. The room was spacious and the bathroom was a good size. The breakfast buffet was ample, and the computer in the lobby for guests was very handy. The staff was very helpful and friendly. It was very easy to get to from the Aerobus, which was a nice benefit. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Ana_Alice_Marques
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend chose this hotel considering it's price and mainly because of it's location, near Las Ramblas, and I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised as we got there, because the service and the facilities were great! It is situated in the heart of the city but the street (Carrer del Carmen) is quiet and no noise was heard at night ... the staff is very very helpful and friendly ... the room was clean and tidy, with a sober but tasteful decoration ... the breakfast had a good buffet ... and it has free wifi. Therefore I recommend this excelent price/quality relation hotel. I had an unforgettable time in this amazing city and so I wish I can go back eventually and I'll definitely try to stay in this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: linz68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 night swith my son and father. Excellent location, about 100m off the centre of Las Ramblas. Rooms are not the biggest but very clean and tidy and you do not expect to spend too much time in there. Good breakfast, helpful friendly staff, and an excellent shower! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably good place! Clean, quiet, central, good price, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: chenav
Reviews.Content: Look. No. Further. Words cannot describe how great it was to stay at this hotel! Everything about it is great. Feels and looks like it was built only last week with a smooth, clever interior design. Rooms are not too big but are perfect for couples, very clean and comfortable. It really feels like you're the first ever to use them! Great air conditioning and hot water all hours of the day. Staff is INCREDIBLY friendly, they all speak perfect English and are willing to help with whatever you need during your stay in the city. Free, fast WiFi in the rooms and also a free computer down at the lobby. Breakfast every morning was very satisfying. Location - superb! Literally one minute from La Rambla and two from the metro station. Plus you get discounts for all sorts of shops nearby the hotel. Now for the few cons: no safe in the rooms, no closest (only open shelves and clothes hangers) ... actually that's it. Go Curious!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen better”
Reviews.Author: gelen12008
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute (a day before we came), and as it is the low season the price was absolutely fantastic. Best hotel ever, great value for money. Everything was just perfect! Try the FRESCO restaurant apposite to the hotel. We're sorry we only found in out last day.

Reviews.Title: “Keep this place a secret”
Reviews.Author: Suffolk-Seniors
Reviews.Content: Don't tell everyone but this is the most convenient, friendliest, most helpful hotel in Barcelona. Only a few steps from Las Ramblas but so, so quiet. Bright decor, clean and comfortable rooms and a hearty breakfast (nothing fancy, just goof tuck!) make this a great value stay for business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel in perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Barker80
Reviews.Content: Everything was just perfect, not only rooms but also receptionists...STRONGLY RECOMMEND.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, clean rooms, service with a smile, and a generous breakfast as the cherry on the cake!”
Reviews.Author: barleiden
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay here! Whenever you pass the lobby there's someone present with a smile on their face, a pleasant welcome! The rooms are modern and clean, and the breakfast was generous; toast, buns, juice, fruit etc... The only disadvantage; we arrived by rental car and since the hotel does not have a parking, we had to park in a private parking in a parallel street with costed us 28 euro for 12 hours. This is of course not the fault of the hotel, but you do need to consider these kind of costs, if arriving by car.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT QUALITY/PRICE RATIO”
Reviews.Author: muchodanger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, 2 steps from Ramblas and public transports, but absolutely no noise from the streets around. Rooms are very clean and confy, with all you need. Breakfast is a buffet one, with coffee milk marmalade butter croissants bagels cornflakes ham cheese chorizo orange juice tea yougurt. Actually for the price we payed is a real bargain, I absolutely will be there again when I'll come back in Barcelona. A special mention for Mateo, the morning time concierge, who is a very nice and professional person really making all he can to make your stay as confy as possible. DEFINITELY WORTHS !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl0309
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating front desk staff, lovely breakfast to get you started for your day. Excellent location in the heart of La Rambla, very safe and very quiet. I was a single female who came back to the hotel around 11pm every night and felt very secure in the area! close to various Metros and beautifully decorated and superbly clean rooms. I will stay here again when I return to Barcelona :-)

Reviews.Title: “Someone opened my room at 1:15 AM and started laughing”
Reviews.Author: swmorgan
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. It is modern. I had a room by the elevator, so the noise was excessive. But at 1:15 AM two people opened my room and started laughing. I called to the reception and they said the system had made a mistake and I was supposed to forget about it and go back to bed since it had been corrected. There is no other lock on the door so if someone has a key to my room I can't lock it besides this.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: RobRoss40
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to book a hotel on a budget then Hotel Curious is the one for you. Fantastic value for money. I speak on behalf of a group of 12, who were visiting Barcelona on a 3 day visit. From the day I looked to book the rooms to the minute we walked out of the hotel, the staff were so friendly, kind and helpful. A special thank you must go to Mateo on the front desk. The location is excellent, 1 minutes walk from La Ramblas and its very quiet. Other people have mentioned that the rooms are not big enough... this is a budget 1 * hotel the rooms were more than adequate for the amount you pay. Breakfast was good, cleanliness excellent (and thats coming from my wife, so believe me 'excellent' does not do it enough justice) Next time we visit Barcelona we are thinking of taking the kids with us...we will be returning to Hotel Curious. Stop looking at other hotels just book this one.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Ever Could Have Imagine”
Reviews.Author: patfriedlander
Reviews.Content: Hotel Curious is located steps off Las Ramblas; the location could not be better. Barcelona is a walking city, and the hotel is perfectly located to walk to the cathedral, the water, the Plaza Catalonia, everywhere. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Breakfast is good--the coffee is superb. I can't say enough good things about this hotel! The value is unbelievable. I travel alot, and I've stayed in many hotels that purport to be 5 star and the service and ambiance don't begin to equal that at Hotel Curious.The hotel is also down the block from the opera house, making it easy to enjoy a performance. And there is free wi fi--GOOD wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !”
Reviews.Author: doxiegirllover
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in Barcelona. I arrived @ midnight and the front desk was so welcoming and accomidating. Great location ( 2-3 minute walk to the Ramblas ), but was at a quiet location which was a big plus. The single rooms are a bit small and cramped , but VERY clean. The staff @ the front desk were very helpful with questions, and were so personable, unlike many 4 to 5 star hotels I have stayed in. Thanks for a great stay in Barcelona !

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mojito29
Reviews.Content: There is nothing to fault this hotel at all. I booked it because of the reviews here and was so pleased i did. My fiance and myself stayed here late November this year. We took the airbus from the airport to plaza catalunya, which i would recommend to everyone. Only 5.50euro each and its the last stop so you cant go wrong! The hotel is around a 10 minute walk from there. The hotel is in an excellent location, just hidden off the busy La Rambla. It is spotlessly clean and has a elments theme to each floor with funky wall paper to represent it behind each bed in the rooms. Breakfast is basic but there is a good choice. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: sgin21
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2-night stay at Hotel Curious. Our room, just right for the 3 of us, was very clean, warm, & the beds comfortable. The reception desk staff were always very helpful & friendly, & gave us lots of local information. Breakfast was fresh & with plenty of choice. We'll certainly recommend this hotel to any friends who visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly situated city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: jclarke12
Reviews.Content: Situated off the main strip, La Ramblas, but you wouldn't know it at night. Our room faced the small side street and there was no unnecessary noise. The hotel was a perfect B&B city centre place. Rooms simple but adequate. Bathroom fine. If you like to hang a lot of clothes you may need to ask for more hangers! The self service breakfast was just right and would suit most countries' tastes, and also open for a good time. We overslept the first morning and came down around 10.30am but everything was fresh and hot. This hotel has an advantage in that the staff are excellent. They are helpful, knowledgeable and very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Wonderar
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! So easy to find from the Aerobus (17.50e return for 2 valid 9 days) which stops outside El Corte Ingles in Plaza Catalunya. Just cross square, left down to Ramblas then turn right into carrer Carme after big church. 5 minutes? Very welcome check-in by Mateo who also gave us a Hotel Curious discount card for free to use in various cafes, shops etc in the vicinity of the hotel. Very usefull and we got good discounts too. Given lots of info by Mateo as well regarding walks round the area and we also saved 4 euros for tickets for the Barcelona tourist bus from him as well. Room small but fine. Bathroom with shower only all very clean. We opened the window to the lift shaft for ventalation after using the shower. The door key card also serves all the electrics in the room so you have to slip it in the holder next to the door to use the lights etc. We had a small balconey but the view out to the building site immediatley next door was quite scary! Just a hollow shell held up with scaffolding. You also felt you could shake hands with your neighbours opposite but as it was winter we did'nt go out there! Could have done with drawer storage as hate having clothes on display, but to save space they had 2 drop down table tops plus a long shelf running across the top. Very quiet situation as well considering they are only yards away from the Ramblas which were heaving that time of year! Breakfast good too,typically continental with a good selection of different foods plus good coffee too! The pros was the location as it has everything going for it, the chocolate Granja shops only across the Ramblas in Carrer Petritxol, Museum of modern art minutes the other way, then off the Ramblas themselves hundreds of the small quirky shops that are impossible to find elsewhere. The cons mainly was the hard bed, both our backs ached all the time! Needed another blanket on the bed rather then turning up the air-con, shower flooded the floor around the screen door and the view outside the balconey! Would I go again? Yes! Lovely staff, excellent value for money, and the location could'nt be beat! We actually saw some other hotels we had considered but after seeing this one glad we made the right choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelAvecLili
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Curious was ideal for a quick trip to BCN. It is within walking distance to almost all of the sites worth visiting and close to a metro station for the few places not within walking distance. The room price was an good value for the location and included breakfast. The modern decor was fun. Also, given the location I was surprised by how quiet it was.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: cherryames1949
Reviews.Content: What a treasure! The location was perfect. Only two short blocks from Las Ramblas. The staff was outstanding. They couldn't be more accommodating or helpful. The rooms were small by US standards but they were spotlessly clean. Breakfast was a great way to start the day before heading out to sightsee. The room rate didn't break the bank either. I can't wait to return to Barcelona and I will definitely be staying at the Curious.

Reviews.Title: “A Well-hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Gannet59
Reviews.Content: I planned this trip as a surprise for my wife. I found the Hotel Curious through an Internet search of Barcelona, which we had both always wanted to visit. The pre-visit advice from the hotel was extremely helpful in planning. On arrival we were given a very warm welcome by Mateo who drew up a map of all we might want to see as well as offering excellent advice on where to eat - local restaurants predominently patronised by locals. The room on the first floor overlooking the narrow street was perfect. Amazingly, though only about 200 metres from Las Ramblas, it was quiet throughout our visit. Very comfortable beds and en-suite bathroom - always immaculately cleaned. A short walk turning right brought us to Las Ramblas. Turn right again to stroll down to the Port or left to the Plaza Catalunya. Behind is one of Barcelona's wonderfully colourful markets. Leave the Hotel turning left and crossing the road to find several excellent and inexpensive restaurants. And across Las Ramblas into the maze of narrow streets and alleyways of the Old City. As I was celebrating my 81st birthday, we decided to take Mateo's advice and ride round Barcelona on the top of the tourist bus. Very comfortable, very good earphone commentary and a wonderful way to get a glimpse of this enchanting and lively city. And always the welcoming Hotel Curious to come back to. Oh and we must not forget the excellent and generous breakfast each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Excellent Location, Great Staff !”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaPeng
Reviews.Content: I rate Hotel Curious very high even though the rooms are small. I knew this when I booked, but thought this location would be good, the price was only 70E online, and it was rated very well. One of the biggest factors in booking Curious was the communication I had prior to booking. Claudio is amazing and so helpful...all the staff was great tho... the emails and questions were answered promptly and proffesionally. I have a bit of a color hang-up as far as rooms go and the staff went out of thier way to accomodate me... and I know this can be a pain...but I always state my preference and if ok...great...if not...no big deal... These guys were great !! From the chocolates they leave to the greatly appreciated CLEAN room & bedding...very very clean at this hotel. I loved having the large window and balcony and would put my bags out there when in the room for added space. One suggestion I would make to the managament would be to add more blockage to the railing on the balconies for more privacy. They had some fake greenery and I think adding more would def improve the atmosphere as the view is not so good back there... but again, for the price... no complaints. The charming fellow that works days always was so helpful with directions and such...and yes...the metro was so easy to use. Easy walking distance to many attractions, I loved walking thru el raval , and all the wonderful side streets off La Ramblas... La Ramblas is a zoo and had no interest there but this Hotel is such a great location to everything else. Easy walk for me and my large luggage from Placa Catalunya. Supermarket very close and everything you need very handy. I am a solo traveller and felt very safe in this area. Loved this hotel and the location is hard to beat !! Will def be back next year !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Barcelona hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kafran
Reviews.Content: My finance and I stayed at Hotel Curious for 3 nights in Oct 2010 and have nothing but good things to say about it. The hotel itself is quite trendy, yet very warm and inviting. The staff was amazing, giving us great tips on things to see and do. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet was the best we found of any of the hotels we stayed at during our travels in Spain. The location is unbeatable, right off La Rambla, on a quiet street, not far from Plaza Catalunya. Would definitely stay there again, and have already recommended it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED, LOVED, LOVED everything about Hotel Curious!!!”
Reviews.Author: airykykee
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Curious for 4 days, prior to setting sail on our Mediterranean cruise. We loved the nice, open modern lobby and the friendly gent, Mateo when he welcomed us after arriving via taxi from the airport. We were pleasantly surprised when we opened the door to our quaint, tidy, clean room...then to go out on the balcony and see the view!! WOW! It was very quiet and we slept well. The breakfast was great with lots of variety. Very close to Las Ramblas- the 'main drag'! The two of us women always felt safe. The staff...Gwen, Carmen, Mateo and Alejandro were very pleasant and always willing to help us with directions and anything we needed. We loved everything about Hotel Curious and will always have wonderful memories of how kind and helpful the staff was to us American tourists. Upon returning home to MN, I contacted my travel agent to tell her how wonderful this place was and to definitely refer her other clients to this awesome hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, one of the best”
Reviews.Author: nerjagirlTipperary
Reviews.Content: Just back from Barcelona where we stayed in Hotel Curious. Have to say it was really a great hotel.From our arrival to departure we were looked after so well. Nothing a problem for the great staff. I forgot my eu plug and they were able to supply mewith one. Staff so helpful explaining where to visit, best tour operators to use,anything you needed to know!Room was lovely, with balcony overlooking the street. Great shower, rooms cleaned everyday. Will definitely be going back and recommending this hotel to all friends and family. One felt very safe there,door locked at all times, you just had to ring bell.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: P_M_T2010
Reviews.Content: Great location, just one or two minutes walking from Las Ramblas. Great deal! Breakfast is included in the price and it's not a big buffet, but it's really good! The fruits are really good and very sweet. Room is simple, but very comfortable. However, a mini frigobar in the room would be great. Wifi is also included on the price and worked well. Staff is very friendly. A nice employee gave us a lot of tips when we arrived. I would definitely recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Barney222
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location can walk to most sites,friendly and helpful staff nothing was a problem for them, good breakfast which is included in the price, wifi in rooms worked well and little details had been well thought out,can recommend Bar Mirinda,and Lobo turn left up alley Carrer Den Xucla 2 mins from hotel. This is an up and coming area so get there before its spoilt! Yes would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Do not be fooled by the one-star! - Barcelona's best kept secret place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nonspecific
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by the one-star! - Barcelona's best kept secret place to stay. (The one-star is to keep prices down). My stay at Hotel Curious was phenomenal. I admit that I was anxious about the one-star status, booking online (from Canada). After reading the MANY positive reviews and comments, we decided to book. Mateo was very helpful in coordinating a room for us, and was diligent in sending email communication back and forth. We went to La Merce 2010 (Barcelona's biggest celebration) - so it was very busy. A room was found for us (there are only 30-some rooms). The rooms are BEAUTIFUL, with high ceilings, and an entire wall mural. I found the room size fine, although small, there is a very clever usage of space. There was a balcony, and functional temperature control. DTV has several foreign language channels. It has been recently renovated. Clean, comfortable, and cozy. The location is amazing. Right on Las Ramblas, and 2 blocks from the Liceu metro stop (everything is accessible). No problems with food or entertainment. 1 block from La Boqueria market. Service is the best. There is an INCLUDED continental breakfast, with cereals, yogurt, breads, fresh fruits.... Meats including sausage, spanish ham, cheeses, warm hard-boiled eggs. Beverages all sorts. The staff are knowledgeable, and give excellent suggestions for trips, and touring. Their English is very strong, and very helpful. They will help you with calling, and allow you to print off your boarding passes for free. WIFI is free. Summary: Absolutely the best kept secret place to stay in Barcelona, for multiple reasons: Affordability - best price for quality stay, including breakfast. Location - on Las Ramblas near metro stop. Service - knowledgeable staff, and very approachable. Quality - excellent renovations, (looks more like a 3-4 star). Downsides - nil really. I thought the rooms were cozy, and large enough. Yen, from Canada. (I usually NEVER fill these things out). - I also stayed at another 3-star hotel prior to Hotel Curious - 2 blocks away, and this was a far better find!

Reviews.Title: “Best city centre Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cabannacopa
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't have been in a better location, right in the centre The decor in the room was great too. We had a little balcony in our room that we could see the quite and nice Carme St. The hotel is very modern and trendy but not in a way that makes you feel uncomfortable. Our room was large and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was nice: some fruits, cereal, pastries cheese, etc. served from 8am to 11am. Service people have been very, very friendly We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a safe area of town”
Reviews.Author: Leia082
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel close to everything you need in Barcelona. Just off the main street of Las Rambles this hotel was in a decent area and was a short, safe walk to get home at night (unlike some other parts of town). Staff here were incredibly helpful and friendly. The only problem we had was that there was some construction going on out the back so it woke us up of a morning. Breakfast is basic but filling and a good start to the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: penss
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel based on reviews. What a mistake. The only positive thing about this place is its location, it's smack in the center of everything. Rooms are tiny, there was no fridge where you could put at least a water bottle inside during really hot days. Rooms are not soundproof, you could hear everything!! There is no storage space, no cupboards, just a chair and a couple of hangers on a steel rod. The mattress was horrible and furniture in general was on the cheap side. Bathroom was tiny... tiny... tiny... and the shower leaked. The room was very dark and because we were in the back part of the hotel we had to keep the light open at all times. Breakfast was really lame nothing was really fresh. Staff were were utterly and highly indifferent. The problem is that I did not get what I payed for and mind you this hotel is not at all cheap!!!! I've been to 2 cheap-so-to-speak-hostel type hotels like this one, one in Berlin and one in Madrid and they are of the same standard but half the price of this place!!! I'm trying to think of something nice to say, but I can't. Overall I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A PLACE TO GO TO”
Reviews.Author: j_stratford
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 27 an 28 , Stayed here because of the reveiws on tripadviser,they were all true.What a great place to stay,clean goood breakfast,quite comfortable bedrooms ,a great postion ,just of the Ramblas.Staff could'nt have been more helpful,as Spain went on strike on departure day,they did everything they could to help us.Would go back again na recommend to anyone going to Barcelona.A great find ,non smoking throughout Front of house all spoke very good English,usful when needing advice about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and shower.”
Reviews.Author: BaronessEast
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I am surprised that this hotel is only '1 star'. It is very comparable to 3 star hotels that I have stayed at in Barcelona. The hotel is located right next to Las Ramblas and the market, so you are always in the middle of the action but without the noise. The rooms are spotless and the beds are firm. Two people can comfortably fit. Best of all, the showers have great water pressure and are always super hot. And it has free WiFi! FREE WIFI! THANK YOU! The only complaint is that since the floors are all wood I was easily awaken in the mornings by the cleaning staff. But I would def recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small & Noisy rooms but clean and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: jojobrew
Reviews.Content: A modern and clean hotel with good friendly and helpful staff, breakfast was a continental buffet with enough choice to start your day. The location is excellent, 1 minute walk and you are right in the middle of the Ramblas and walking to the Harbour and Cathedral is no problem. The letdown was the room, we had so much to see that luckily we didn't spend too much time there but it was small and basic, no bath, no furniture just a rail and a couple of shelves and a very small balcony that we couldn't open the door to due to the fact the neighbours had their TV on mega-loud, however the room did have AC which worked quite well. If we could book again we'd spend the extra money as at £100 a night this didn't feel like great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ESummers
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel while searching on Tripadvisor and, after reading some reviews, our expectations were high. I can tell you we weren’t disappointed! When it comes to location you can’t ask for more: it’s right in the center of Barcelona and yet, as it’s located on a small side street, you can rest at night. As for the rooms, we booked a double and a twin, the former was slightly smaller than the latter, but both of them were decent-sized. The beds were comfortable and clean, just like everything at the hotel. Both bathrooms were spotless and they even had a make-up mirror! The breakfast buffet was very good and included several flavors of yogurt, orange juice, coffee, fruit, bread, cereals, croissants, … This is the only point where we’d like to make a suggestion. We think it would be good if one of the breakfast cereals was replaced for muesli. However, we loved the breakfast buffet! The staff was really friendly, helpful and polite. The hotel has Wi-Fi and there’s also a computer in the lobby that you can use for free. We stayed here for 4 nights in early August and we loved it! We’d love to go back and we will recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location; Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jewel_1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in August after reading previous reviews. The hotel, although pretty small and indeed our room was quite small, is in an excellent location, spotlessly clean and I can not fault the staff from the politeness of the morning breakfast staff to the reception staff who were very helpful. We hired bikes from a place a couple of sidestreets away and the bike shop said that although the bike hire was for 24hrs unless the hotel had somewhere to put them then we would have to return them that night. When we asked the lady on reception it was no problem at all and we were able to leave the bikes in the lobby which meant that we could use them for the whole of that evening. Our flight wasn't until late in the evening and again it was no problem leaving our bags there and coming later to freshen up. My husband's only request to improve would have been for there to be an ice machine or as someone said earlier perhaps a fridge. And my only request (although I understand the hotel was a minimalistic style, would be to have had a cupboard to put clothes in). We had a lovely few days there - great city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - spotlessly clean, great service!!”
Reviews.Author: MarkManchester_UK
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona and, based on Trip Advisor reviews, we stayed here for 4 nights in August 2010 (triple room). The Hotel Curious is indeed small and quaint but the location is just perfect. Situated on a small side street but far enough away from the noise and just two minutes walk from The Ramblas which is the main tree lined ‘tourist thoroughfare’ from Playa La Catalunya to the waterfront. The Liceu Metro station is five minutes walk which we used for our journey from the airport (very cheap – buy a T10 ticket for 6.70EUR which gives you ten journeys on all metros, buses and local trains). Please don’t be put off by the 1 star rating (as I almost was) as for customer service, cleanliness and security it is first class. We stayed in a triple room at the front of the hotel on the fourth floor, overlooking the street but although rather small it was kept spotlessly clean and had air conditioning. Ours had a picture of a Gaudi building on the wall. The simple breakfast included in the room rate, while not very exciting (cereals, cheeses, bread, fruit, croissants, tea/coffee and use of a toaster) was adequate before setting off for the day. I think the guy who checked us in has been mentioned before in these reviews as he was extremely helpful, spoke perfect English and gave us maps, pointing out all of the things we might want to see during our stay. As with others we took his advice and were not short of things to see or do. If this place was twice the size and had a bar and a restaurant it would be a 3 or even a 4 star hotel. We would most definitely recommend and stay again if we return to Barcelona. The city is fabulous and we could have stayed for a week!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dkozee
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is small and quaint, just a couple of blocks off of La Rambla. Very close to everything, but two blocks away from all the noise. Nice combination. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The gentlemen who checked us in was extremely helpful. He gave us maps and walked us through it, pointing out all of the sights we might want to visit. That evening there was a different man at the desk, and the only disappointment with this establishment came when we asked for a recommendation for dinner. He said there would be very few places open since it was Sunday and recommended a place down by the Columbus statue near the water. I asked if there was something off La Rambla closer to the hotel that we could grab because we were tired. But he again said probably not much choice since it was Sunday, and that my best bet would be to go to the place he recommended. While waiting for my family to come downstairs, I used the free computer in the lobby and found that the TripAdvisor reviews of the place he recommended were horrible. Not just bad, but horrible. So we decided to find a place on our own. We ended up at a Plaza just a block off La Rambla surrounded with restaurants and outdoor seating that was very lively and VERY OPEN. We had a lovely dinner, in a great location. We felt like the gentlemen at the hotel was pushing the "touristy" restaurant and perhaps there may have been some sort of referral fee. Why would he have otherwise told us there was nothing open on Sunday near the hotel or just off La Rambla. There were numerous choices OPEN. That was very disappointing ,but our stay was otherwise very nice. I would stay there again. T

Reviews.Title: “exactly what i wanted-location, quiet, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: liquidkitty1
Reviews.Content: my friend and i stayed at hotel curious for two nights prior to a cruise, and one night upon return. we met three staff members and all were friendly and helpful, providing map and directions. hotel is 2min walk from central ramblas, about 5min to liceu metro. it is quiet for sleep, beds comfortable, and room spotless. rooms are contemporary and utilize space. you can fit two folding chairs to sit on balcony and drink wine from the grocery store almost across the street and food from the neaby famous market. there is handy free internet and breakfast was great. i would recommend to anyone visiting barcelona who does not want to spend a fortune, since you will not be spending time in the room anyway, but enjoying this vibrant city!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianDude1982
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from July 15-18, 2010 and we really liked it. It's a cool and trendy little hotel with a great location just off La Ramblas. The room was simple but had everything we needed, was clean and stayed cool with the Air Conditioning. Every room has a mural of a scene from Barcelone - ours had a picture of one of Gaudi's buildings and it was pretty impressive. The staff were very helpful and the man who checked us in even took the time to explain a bit of the history of Barcelona to us, pointing out all the major landmarks and places we should see on our short visit. We ended up taking his advice and had a great tour of Barcelona as a result. I had also mentioned on our reservation that it was our 1st Wedding Anniversary and when we entered our room there was a box of chocolates waiting for us there - I'm sure they don't do that often but it was a very nice touch. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others who are planning a trip to Barcelona. I loved the city, the people, the food and our hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location. Very clean. Free in room secured wi-fi. Breakfast included.”
Reviews.Author: CV-HappyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. 3rd floor. Room (twin) was bigger than I expected. Street view. So good location: - 10min from Placa Catalunya, where AeroBus (public bus from airport, 5E/pers) and Sightseeing buses stop. From Placa Catalunya start Las Ramblas, a tree-lined pedestrian boulevard, touristy of course, with colourful market stalls, stylish restaurants, spectacularly-dressed human moving statues. - Street "Carrer del Carme" is one way/one line street, on the right side of Rambla, next street after C/Pintor Fortuny, at L'esglèsia de Betlem, a late 17th-century church at the corner of Carme, easy to spot because of baroque architecture. - At no 25 - on the left side, 1min off La Rambla, is our Curious. - 2-3min from Metro station Liceu. Metro Line 3/green. 5-6min from Catalunya Metro station - a hub where you can change lines. - 12-15min from Placa de Colon/port. - In Barri Gòtic (technically it's in El Raval), close to Gran Teatre Del Liceu-where Paco de Lucia played when we were there, various arts museums, Cathedral.... - On same street : FresCo - all you can eat and drink for 10E, (good and fresh food), one pastry shop with whole meal, rye and corn breads, a fine chocolate shop. On Las Ramblas : La Boquería (Mercat de Sant Josep, with take-away boxes of various ready chopped fresh fruit for 1E), fancy restaurants, popular restaurants, fast food chaines, ice cream shops - one of which, near Placa Catalunya, an italian gelateria, we find to be of best quality ice cream, natural ingredients, with real fruits from all over the world and where we also had a wonderfull thick, bittersweet hot chocolate, shame it's only take away! - El Corte Ingles in Placa Catalunya, the multi-storey building for a superb shopping experience. All the designer brands laid out clearly. Hotel itself is built for efficiency, clean, modern, spartan, looks like new in a historic building, quiet, each floor has its own theme (wallpaper) displayed on the door and room wall. Very friendly and helpful front desk staff, excellent maid service every day. - Safe - the entrance door is remote-activated by the front desk personnel, 24 hour reception service. - Free in-room wi-fi internet, one computer in lobby. - A/c, TV, telephone. - Decent/good breakfast included : butter, cream cheese and yogurt in minifridge, hot/cold water dispenser, teas, cereals, jams, croissant, breads, hot and cold milk, coffee, ham, salami, bacon strips, cheese, hard-boiled eggs, orange juice. There are 2 bread toasters. - Comfortable beds-I like the hardness of the matresse, 1 chair, 1 armchair. For the sense of space there is no closet, only hangers under a shelf and wall mounted fold-away desk. - Bathroom with exhaust fan (ventilation). Amenities : soap, shower gel, shampoo, hair-drier, make-up mirror, towels-changed every day. Minor issues, not disturbing: - Slow draining in shower/bathtub. - Twin Room is big enough and I wonder why the bedside tables are so small. Same in bathroom with the small sink (could be larger). - What I most missed was a place to store our 2 baggages, to keep them off (our) sight. I did some research prior to choose Curious and at same price this is the best option by far.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Curious”
Reviews.Author: Killpop
Reviews.Content: First off, the location is perfect! The hotel is a mere 2 minute walk from las ramblas. Do not be misled by its 1 star classification... in terms of service, cleanliness etc it definitely matches up with that of a 4 star hotel. The individuals at the reception desk were always very helpful, friendly and efficient. We had two rooms... one big twin with the view of the street and a double facing the back. The latter, albeit rather small, was perfect and had all the basic necessities. The twin room on the 2nd floor was more spacious, with a big bathroom. The breakfast was also good as the hotel provides a quite a variety. The free use of the internet in the lobby is also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “The honest truth about Hotel Curious”
Reviews.Author: The_muse_clio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 9 nights: 1. The rooms are not soundproof. a) on my second night I could hear a couple arguing LOUDLY in the evening on my floor, in their own room (not in the hall). It went on for at least an hour and the front desk was called by another person on the floor; b) if there are children staying at the hotel, you can hear them - running and screaming in the hall and in the stairwells (while you're in your room) early in the morning; c) people can hear you have loud sex at 3am. I don't care that you're having sex. I care that it's 3am. 2. Realistically, it's a step up from a hostel. It's clean and people are friendly, but don't count on things like an alarm clock or an actual bed (the mattress sits on a metal frame). My bed squeaked every time I moved. Nor should one expect a closet (there's flimsy storage along one wall - shelves / rod with hangers). 3. The bathrooms are tiny but bigger than the ones I've experienced in London (UK). My shower didn't close properly and leaked. Nevertheless, the housekeeping staff cleans everything up by 1pm and you have a clean bathroom with fresh towels. 4. There are no 'do not disturb' signs for when you want to sleep in. 5. the breakfast provided was not my favourite (croissant, savoury rolls, cured meats, cheese, 2 types of cereal, hard boiled eggs some days, coffee from a machine, orange juice and yoghurt), however there are few options available in the vicinity with most places opening at 10, if not later. 6. AMAZING location. Steps from las ramblas, the boqueria, two metro stations and plenty of history. There's a bakery a few doors down, great restaurants near by and the Carrefour express is only a couple of blocks away on las ramblas for simple groceries like water and snacks (I wouldn't recommend the Dia grocery across the street from the hotel, they don't have the best selection) 7. Again, really great, friendly staff. The front desk people spoke english and french so it made my stay easier. Also, the housekeeping/ kitchen staff spoke english. Other: free wifi in all of the rooms and a computer in the lobby (free use). I would recommend this hotel for a shorter stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for your money in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Traveller189852
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 4-day trip to this fantastic city. As the hotel was fully booked we accepted the alternative to move from a twin-room to a 120cm-bed room and back to the twin-room again..... Although this meant having to leave the room every morning (...) everything worked out very well thanks to the helpful staff. Additionally I must say that the rooms look exactly like they are portrayed in the hotel's website; the beds are more towards the hard kind, but I had not problems with that; the bathrooms are small but with modern details; the breakfast included: coffee & tea/cereal + at least 4 different types of bread + 3 types of hams + cheese + yoghurt + butter/marmalade + juice + hard-boiled eggs. Perhaps something that could be improved: the shower/shampoo gel is provided in very small individual packages that are to be thrown away. Not so attractive and/or convenient. The rooms are rather spartan, but have a very modern feeling. Quite small, but functional. The hotel is located in a side street, a few meters away from the lively Las Ramblas. From the airport there is an easy connection by the AeroBus, which leaves you in Plaza Catalunya. From there you just walk about 3 blocks down Las Ramblas and then make a right turn. In all, I must say that this hotel give you value for the money and I could very well think of returnint here.

Reviews.Title: “Curiously great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: J803
Reviews.Content: The location just off La Rambla (and close by la Boqueria :), the modern design and cool photo wallpapers in the room, the helpful staff, the excellent breakfast - we liked it all! The only downside was the beds, which were a bit too hard for our taste. Would definitely come back again though!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: surfsideBBCA
Reviews.Content: Located just off La Ramblas, Hotel Curious is in a perfect location to see the sights. The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: joy704
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay with hotel curious. We stayed in a double room on the "water themed floor". We arrived earlier than expected, but were able to check into our rooms. The front desk staff was really helpful by giving us a map and explaning everything to us (so far this was the only hotel that we stayed in europe who did that for us). The rooms were clean, and spacious enough for the both of us. I thought the room decorations were simple and cute. Some people may think the bed is hard if you are use to the plush beds, for us we didn't mind it and slept alright. We didn't hear noise coming from the streets in our room. The breakfast was adequate, which included some simple meats, breads, cereal, yogurt, coffee and orange juice which was good enough to start your day. They also offered free wi-fi in the room which was great. The location was great about a 5 min walk to las ramblas, a couple more for the hop on and off tour bus station. We were able to walk to the beach from the hotel. If we plan on coming back to barcelona we would stay again in this hotel. Great hotel staff service, clean rooms, good location =)

Reviews.Title: “unforgetable time at hotel Curiouse”
Reviews.Author: bleen11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely small hatel for 4 days and if we are going to come to Barcelona againe we would gladly stay again. Nice clean rooms, all furniture is new. Nice breacfast and the staff were very friendly and helpfull. The location is perfect for tourists as its just nex to La Rambla, metro and walking distance to beach. We had a great time there and would love to return. Good value for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “One Star Shining”
Reviews.Author: kensmoon
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, good base for exploring the city, decent rooms, okay breakfast, friendly staff, great value for money, spend the extra on another hotel if you have money to burn!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: tangiwai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Curious for 3 nights and found it to be an almost perfect experience. The hotel is situated on a quiet street only a couple of minutes walk to the middle section of La Rambla and less than 5 minutes from the Liceu Metro station. Service was excellent and the manager and night staff were very helpful with providing us with any information we required. We were lucky enough to secure one of the larger rooms in the hotel which was extremely spacious and came with a big bathroom also. Rooms are decorated minimalist style (think IKEA style furniture as another reviewer mentioned) but they were very modern and clean. The beds were comfortable and we didn't hear much street noise despite the fact our room faced the street. The hotel also offers free wi-fi and there is a computer available for use in the lobby. About the only (albeit very minor) issue is that the breakfast could be of a slightly better quality (e.g. providing some fruit would be nice), but at least it was included in the room rate. This does not detract from our overall experience and I can confidently say that, for this price range, it is one of the best hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Very efficient use of space!”
Reviews.Author: natty33
Reviews.Content: This was my first night, of my first trip to Europe. The hotel was very cute and charming. The room was tiny, but well organized, so it didn't seem small. It was perfect for a quick layover for a solo traveler. The room was incredibly clean and nicely decorated. The was a computer in the lobby for guest use, was a lovely touch.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay & won't be the last”
Reviews.Author: F1Annie
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff , rooms sparse but immaculate, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean and retro with an AMAZING location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dicecattt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one night at the Hotel Curious before our 11 night Mediterranean cruise on the Disney Magic. We chose it based on good reviews and frankly, I thought the name was cute. The location is prime, right off La Rambla and by the big food market, there is so much within easy walking distance. The Hotel itself is kind of retro and funky, with a cool design. Free use of their computer. Breakfast was included and was typical for European breakfasts with lots of bread. Rooms were clean and cool looking, with good space usage. The view from the balcony is not good...they tried to put a hanging greenery to block the nasty view of the apartments across but more greenery is needed because you can see the people that live across do not take care of their places. The bed was extremely hard, which some people may like. It did not do good things for my back, although my husband had no problem with it. I thought the staff was very nice, and spoke English very well. I thought this hotel was a great value and a very, very great location...next time I'm in Barcelona I will be staying there again! I will also be booking it for my clients. Just something funny...this was my first experience with a European hotel room and it truly stumped us with the room card insertion for electricity, we were very confused at first, lol.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better based on prior reviews”
Reviews.Author: srk123
Reviews.Content: Traveled alone, so I booked a single room on-line for one night. Room was clean, but very small and spartan, with no view. Very old building which has been re-habbed. One elevator, which holds only 4 people if they don't have baggage. Free continental breakfast was acceptable, but not great. Small bathroom, but everything worked OK. Staff not unfriendly, but not overly helpful either. My reservation was in order; I arrived at 10 am and they gave me my room right then--a big plus as they originally told me I had to wait until 2 pm. Great location, only 1/2 block from the Rambla and easy walking distance from Plaza Catalunya. One free computer in the lobby, but always busy whenever I passed by it--they didn't seem to have posted time restrictions for use. Paid 80 euros for a Saturday night pre-paid stay. Would probably not return due to the very small room.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, but somewhat noisy”
Reviews.Author: Shiput99
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the Curious for 88Euro/night breakfast included. The room was very clean, spacious and well equipped, only a safe was missing (and the minibar for all those who like minibars, what we don't). The location is very central, just 50m off the Rambla and the Barri Gotic. Unfortunately, the building structure is so old and not re-done, that when you neighbour goes for a shower, you have the impression he stands on top of your bed, and we had a neighbour enjoying taking showers early in the morning.... Furthermore, the reception staff was not really helpful, nor smiling. Last but not least, if you expect vitamins in form of fresh stuff like fruits on a breakfast buffet, then do not expect it at the Curious. There are only white bread bakeries, sugar-stuffed convenience junk and cold coffee. Overall, good for small budgets, but not really pleasant in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: GallivantingAgain
Reviews.Content: What a location! Mere yards from the centre of La Ramblas. A great deal of thought that has gone into designing this charming hotel. The four bedroom floors have been themed earth, air, water and fire and colour coded accordingly. The full wall B&W photographs behind the bed heads continue this theme, with my sister and I having the illusion of sleeping in a peaceful courtyard. From the balcony we looked a few yards up the road into La Ramblas. Admittedly the fittings were IKEA, but they were spotlessly clean and fulfilled their purpose admirably, with free hanging and fold away tables to maximise space. There was a full size bath in the well-appointed bathroom. The breakfasts were bountiful and fresh with excellent croissants, breads, meats, cheeses, cereals etc. All served in a fresh, cheerful room off reception. Facilities for the disabled had been provided with level access throughout the ground floor, a disabled toilet and lifts to the bedrooms. Our host couldn't have been more charming and helpful, acting as our own personal tourist information centre. Overall this is a gem of a hotel and I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in future.
