Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacqs62
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Just off Las Ramblas, so it was quiet at night. Good continental breakfast. Staff friendly and helpful. Room small and basic, but that was all we needed. Room cleaned everyday. Bed comfortable. Great shower! 5 minutes away from the metro. Highly recommended and would definately use again.

Reviews.Title: “Curiously enough... the perfect place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: FishyFlipFlop
Reviews.Content: We really did have a great stay at Hotel Curious. 4 of us stayed their for 1 night a couple of weeks ago and we were all in agreement that it ticked every single box for what we look for in a hotel. As soon as we walked through the door we were greeted with a smile, check-in was efficient and the guy on reception was really helpful and gave us loads of information. The whole place from the lobby, to the rooms, bathrooms and dining room is modern, well presented and spotless. It's in a great location on a quieter street just off la Ramblas and about a 5-10 minute walk from where the Aerobus drops off. We got a taxi when we first arrived and the aerobus on the way back and I would say the Aerobus is probably the better, cheaper option. Breakfast was great, continental but a good continetal with tasty meat, bread, jams, yoghurt and warm boiled eggs. There's a computer in the reception that's free to use which is really if you need to use the internet for anything. There's a decent lift that can fit 4 people without their bags. Rooms were'nt massive but they were perfectly comfortable, same with the showerooms (there was no bath). Nice, big, comfy double beds and a welcome change from most other hotels was the heating and air con which worked efficiently and quietly and changed the temperature of the room accurately and quickly. To sum up we really struggled to find any negatives. The only things that might put some people off is that the place is very modern so don't expect anything "homely" and it's also not a 4 or 5 star so no one will be there to help you to your room with your bags (unless, of course, you are someone who needs help in which case i'm sure they would oblige). For the price you really would be hard pressed to fing anywhere else half as good as this place and I really wouldn't hesitate to book again next time I go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, small jewel near the Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: oliver1971
Reviews.Content: 1 block from the Ramblas, no noise at night, great price, good restaurants near the hotel, near the local market, manager very helpful, it a must. We travel all year and we only recommend hotels when they deserve it ;)

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: sassyjem
Reviews.Content: Despite the one/two star rating of this hotel we thought it was superb value. Location was absolutely amazing - only a minutes walk from Las Ramblas and just a short stroll to Placa Catalunya where one could catch the Aerobus, Tour bus and use the Underground. The hotel itself was very clean and tidy and although the room was small, it was comfortable quiet and spotlessly clean. The breakfast, whilst not being 5 star cuisine, was much better than we expected. I would definitely stay in this lovely little hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms, good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: nh_traveler8
Reviews.Content: Not much to add to the other reviews. It's a very quick walk from Placa Catalunya, less than a minute walk from Las Ramblas, and around the corner from La Boqueria. It's not a luxury hotel, but it's clean, the rooms are comfortable, the free breakfast was very good, and the free wifi is a nice bonus. It's a very good value compared to other hotels that are right next to Las Ramblas. The restaurant across the street, Rincon de Aragon, was fantastic! The "Hotel photos" link above takes you to Hotels.com, and the pictures are NOT for this hotel. For photos of this hotel, look at the photos in the upper right that were posted by travelers. We stayed for two nights before a cruise. On the day of the cruise, the hotel stored our luggage in a locked room for us until we were ready to head to the ship. We walked down Las Ramblas to the port with our luggage, which took 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Location and value”
Reviews.Author: mark_SydNSW
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent – a 5-10 minute walk to Placa de Catalunya, the transport hub for the city and the meeting point for most tours, and on a side street from the Rambla (with all its restaurants). There is also a subway stop a couple of minutes away. The staff were friendly and helpful, although there was a woman at the front desk whose understanding of English was not that great. This hotel had everything I needed and was excellent value for money. It is quite new and the rooms were large by European standards and clean. Free breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: WIH
Reviews.Content: Booked directly through internet. everything went smoothly. We arrived late, but this was no problem at all. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Small but clean rooms. Superb location. I would certeinly come here again!

Reviews.Title: “As Advertised; Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ChiWind
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets a lot of foot traffic off of La Rambla and seems to be fully booked quite a bit of the time due to favorable reviews from TA. The people are advised they can get best rate from booking directly with hotel on the internet. In fact, there is a free internet computer in the lobby for guests which is certainly a very nice feature. The room they do not picture on the internet is the one I was originally assigned upon arrival. The single room is next to the elevator shaft so if you open your drapes your view is the elevator. The recessed ceiling lighting is adequate to make up for not having daylight however. There is a nice breakfast room with good choices: small refrigerated unit holds the yogurt and cream cheese/butter. Fresh pastries are brought in every AM. Rolls and ham and cheese allow for putting together a small sandwich for later lunch. Coffee was good one of the three days. Arrival welcome to hotel includes map of the city and lots of good information and tips in English for those who need that. I appreciated that since I had never been to Barcelona before. If you arrive at airport and take the Autobus for just 4.25 Euro to Placa Catalunya it is a very easy walk to the hotel. The crowds and noise on La Rambla is almost non-stop, so it is nice to be a block away from it. Easy walk to many attractions, but Metro stop Licieu very close as well.

Reviews.Title: “First trip abroad for Mum in 20 years - excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fletcher42
Reviews.Content: Three nights in Sunny Barcelona last week. Our room was at the top overlooking the road so a great view of life passing by and surprisingly quiet. All the staff were pleasant, receptionists always welcoming and remembered our names - even writing down their own personal recipe for Sangria ! Breakfast was great, different breads/pastries each day and a variety of cheeses, hams and yogurts. The location was excellent, just steps from Las Ramblas and between two metro stations. Excellent too for Mercat La Boqueria just behind. Rooms cleaned daily. What more is there to say? Certainly on the list for a re-visit. Can't beleive it only displays one Star at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: elc48
Reviews.Content: Just home from spending 3 nights at Hotel Curious. Were a bit worried about what to expect as booked over a budget booking site but worries completely unfounded. The hotel is in a perfect location, a couple of minutes walk from Plaza de Catalunya, where the aerobus stops, and La Ramblas, so within easy walking distance from bars and restaurants. The reception staff were very helpful and all staff we met were very friendly and willing to help. The hotel is quite basic but is modern, stylish and VERY clean. Our room was quite small - we had requested 3 single beds and so didn't have too much room to spare - but for what we wanted it was adequate. We had a small balcony overlooking the street but we weren't disturbed by noise in the night. The only complaint about noise might be that the walls are quite thin although we weren't disturbed by thisas only had someone next door one of the nights. The room was left spotless every day and although we didn't request it we had clean towels every day. If you want a luxury hotel then this is not the place for you, but for value for money and a place to lay your head this is a perfect low-cost option that we will definitely be going back to if we go to Barcelona again.
